* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for towesl, fans, caps and the materials needed in embroidery.

loans.name: Gulmayram

texts.ru: Гулмайрам 49 лет, замужем. У нее с мужем 4 взрослых детей.   Гулмайрам с 1997 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 30,000 сом (KGS). По хозяйству активно помогает муж и сын  Гульмайрам. Благодаря упорному труду Гулмайрам и её семьи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы и мелко рогатый скот, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 15,000 (KGS)сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмайрам обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 дойных коров. Доходы от кредита Гулмайрам планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины. Ей предстоит весной отыграть свадьбу дочери.
texts.en: Gulmayram is 49 years old and she is married with four grown children.  Since 1997, she has been involved in raising cattle, a business she started with 30,000 som (KGS).  Her husband and son actively help her on the farm.  Thanks to the hard work of Gulmayram and her family, the farm now has three cows and a herd of sheep and goats.  The sale of their milk and dairy products brings about 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  With the goal of developing her business further, Gulmayram has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy three dairy cows.  She plans to use the income from this loan to increase her head of livestock in the future.  Her daughter is getting married in the spring.

loans.use: to purchase three dairy cows.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 52, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Bienvenido and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lolita operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from this, she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1200 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost to her income as she expands her business.  

Lolita hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of having her own house and a car. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Riorita

texts.en: Riorita is a 38-year-old resident of San Juan, Pana-on. Riorita helps her family’s needs with the little amount of 4,000 she gains monthly from her gardening business that she has had for 2 years. However in 2011 she's been a member of GDMPC, and is applying for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Riorita wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 41 years old, and a married entrepreneur from Poblacion, Sinacaban with 4 children and is earning a wage from her transport service business. She started it almost 3 years ago now and she earns 3,000 a month. To improve business, she is requesting to borrow an amount of 5,000 from GDMPC micro credit, which she just recently joined, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth and thread to make artificial flowers.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is married with three children. She is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Laura runs and manages a general store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more 21 years and earns PHP 8,000 per month. Laura requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Laura has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC since 2009. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business and finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina lives with her family in Ubay, Bohol.  Seh earns a living with her videoke machine, which she has been doing for five years.

Macrina is requestiing a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of her videoke machine.  In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
This is Agustina, a 47-year-old resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Agustin and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
Agustina operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Aside from this she also raises pigs in her compound. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20, 000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy plastics and other recyclable materials for her junkshop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Agustina hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for plastics and other recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is from Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Rita owns and operates a general store. Rita has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Rita joined GDMPC. Rita is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps to sell in her store.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
This is Ma. Dolores, 45, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ramil, a driver and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Ma. Dolores operates a dental clinic. She manages her dental clinic's operation. She offers dental check-ups, tooth extractions and other dental procedures. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to maintain her clinic and to buy operative supplies. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Dolores dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to maintain her clinic and buy operative supplies.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
This is Jeffrey. He previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he used to buy stocks of charcoal. His earnings were a big help in his personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. He is also into the electronic loading business for additional income. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jeffrey simply hopes to have a good life with his parents, siblings and grandfather. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal for his business.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est une femme dynamique de 36ans. Son conjoint est tailleur et ils ont ensemble 02 enfants de 06 et 02ans dont 01 scolarisé. Elle revend de la friperie à domicile et achète les marchandises au marché de HEDZRANAWOE. Avec ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle va s’approvisionner en marchandise pour revendre et tirer des profits. Elle veut développer son activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Dédé is a dynamic 36-year-old woman. Her spouse is a tailor and the couple have 2 children together, aged 6 and 2, one of whom attends school. Dédé sells second-hand clothing at home and gets her products at the market of Hedzranawoe. With this first loan that she is requesting, she will buy some merchandise to resell and make profits on. She would like to develop her business and to ensure that her family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children from Bohol, Philippines. She is has engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 5 years now. This is the source of their income.
Mary Ann is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.
Mary Ann hopes of expanding her business in the future and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock on salt, rice, mineral water and sugar.

loans.name: Délali

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produit d’alimentation générale à son domicile, Délali est une dame âgée de 57 ans. Malgré son âge, elle demeure et ambitionne de grands projets pour son activité qu’elle a débuté en l’an 2000. Elle est mariée et mère d'01 enfant.  Elle sollicite son quatrième crédit auprès de WAGES pour renforcer le commerce des produits d’alimentation. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité et acheter un terrain pour construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en: Délali sells groceries from her home. She is 57 years old. Despite her age, she remains ambitious and has big plans for her business which she started in 2000. She is married and the mother of one child. She is requesting her 4th loan from WAGES in order to strengthen her grocery-selling business. She would like to reinvest in her business and buy some land on which to build a family home.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Kantayim

texts.ru: Кантайым 53-летний фермер, живущая в с Кызылбулак (Юго-западной часть Кыргызстана). Двое из четырех детей Кантайым, так также как и их дед, стали фермерами и помогают в семейном бизнесе. С 1994 года семья Кантайым успешно занимается разведением скота и перепродажей сельхоз продукции. Начав со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), Кантайым смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом в 7,000 сом. Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Кантайым обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Кантайым намерена использовать для постройки нового сарая в целях обеспечения хороших условий для содержания скота и весной планирует женить сына.
texts.en: Kantayim is 53 years old and is a farmer living in Kyzylbulak (in the southwest of Kyrgyzstan).  Two of her four children, a well as their grandfather, have become farmers and help in the family business.  Since 1994, Kantayim's family have been successful in raising livestock and selling their products at the market.  Beginning with a starting sum of 5,000 som (KGS), Kantayim has increased her farm's monthly income to 7,000 som.  To further increase the size of her herd, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy some more livestock to raise.  She plans on using her increased income to build a new barn so she can improve the living conditions of her cattle and to marry off her son in the spring.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 42 years old, married, and has three chidren.  She is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is a heavy equipment operator.  She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Analyn operates an accessories retail business. She buys accessory items from wholesalers and sells them per piece/pack for a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Analyn is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy different products such as toys, pony tail holders, and different gift items. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Analyn hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase products such as toys, pony tail holders, and different gift items.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and pay for her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Norma hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is married and has four children.  She received a junior high school education. He husband is a petty trader.  She  sells provisions and other food items at Abura, which she has been doing for four years.  As part of her responsibilities, she helps in providing food for her family. 

Gifty is requesting a  loan, which she will use to purchase a variety of provisions,  such as tubers, yams, cassavas, plantains, and other food items to sell. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tubers, yams, cassavas, plantains, and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama has been a baker for 12 years. She bakes doughnuts, pastries and bread for sale in Abura. Ama has 5 children and is responsible for their upkeep. She will use her loan to buy flour and sugar for her bakery. Ama plans to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar for her bakery

loans.name: Jastiner

texts.en:
Jastiner, 34 years old, is a retail shop owner in Mombasa. She is married and she and her husband support four people. Jastiner has been in this business for the last two years and she is doing well. 

Jastiner will use the requested loan to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat for her shop. She will use the anticipated profit to pay her children's school fees. This is Jastiner's second loan; the previous one was repaid successfully. She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat for her shop

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua produces palm oil for sale. She has been in this business for 4 years now. She lives with her husband and 5 children at Mbeam, near Abura. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying for their children’s school fees. Efua will use her loan to purchase palm fruits and other ingredients that she will use to produce palm oil. With her new profits, she will create larger quantities of her product.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruits and other ingredients that she will use to produce palm oil.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame lives with her husband, a farmer, and 5 children in Mbeam, near Abura.  For the past 10 years, Maame has extracted palm oil for sale and has also sold kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and palm fruit. She uses her income to support  her husband in paying their children's school fees. Maame will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey and palm fruit for extracting oil for sale. Maame will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for making kenkey and palm fruit for extracting oil for sale

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine lives in Gyumri with her daughter, Gohar. She works at a local school. Her daughter studies at Gyumri State Medical College in the nursing department. 

As Hermine has raised her child alone, it is very difficult for her to sustain the family and save money for her daughter's education. She is requesting a loan to pay for university tuition. The loan is very important for Hermine and her daughter so that she can complete her education and find a job. Gohar hopes to become professional nurse and help people.

loans.use: to pay for university education.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi lives with her husband who is a farmer and her four children at Mbeam near Abura. Asi produces fanti kenkey for sale. Fanti kenkey is a local food that is similar to sourdough dumplings and is made out of maize. She has been in this business for six years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their bills. Asi will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to produce her kenkey for sale. With the new profits she earns, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to produce her kenkey (dumplings) for sale.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is a seamstress who makes dresses for sale at Mbeam near Abura. Akua has received an education through the secondary school level. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Akua has been into this business for four years. She is responsible for caring for her children and paying other household expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase fabrics and materials  to make her dresses for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials to make her dresses for sale.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
This is Luis; he previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan which he used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in paying for his family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Luis would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profits. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. He also has a direct selling business and a water station for additional income. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Luis hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving his children a good education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Mamasayid

texts.ru:
Мамасайид 53 - летний мужчина проживающий в районе Хуросон. Он женат. Мамасайид является отцом четверых детей. Жена Мамасайида домохозяйка. Его дети находятся на заработках за рубежом. По профессии Мамасайид учитель. Он преподает в школе. В этой области он работает более тридцати лет.
Мамасайид вот уже три года занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он закупает скот, разводит 30-45 дней потом продает. 
Мамасайид берет кредит для закупа бычков и теленка.
texts.en: Mamasayid is 53 years old and he lives in the Khuroson region.  He is married with four children.  His wife is a homemaker and his children work abroad.  Mamasayid is a teacher - he works in a school and he has been in this profession for more than thirty years.  For the last three years he has been buying and selling large livestock.  He buys animals, raises them for 30-45 days and then sells them.  Mamasayid is asking for a loan to buy bulls and calves.

loans.use: to buy bulls and calves

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is widowed and has 5 children. She sells kenkey, a fermented corn dough wrapped in banana leaves, and farmed products at Mbeam, near Abura. She has done this for 10 years. Efua uses her income to care for her children and pay other household expenses. Efua will use the loan to purchase bags of corn for her kenkey. With the profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of corn for her kenkey.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fresh to fry for sale.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is a widow and has 10 dependents.  She produces fanti kenkey (a fermented corn and cassava dough that is wrapped in corn or banana leaves) at Mbeam near Abura, which she has been doing for four years.  

Akosua is requesting a loan, which she will use to  purchase bags of maize and  firewood  used in producing  her kenkey.  She uses her income to feed her dependents and to pay her accommodation bills.  With the loan, Akosua will be able to produce in large quantities and earn additional profits.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and  firewood.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua  is married and has five children. She sells frozen chicken, meat, and fish at Mbeam near Abura, which she has been doing for four years. Her husband is a farmer. 

Afua is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase chicken, meat, and fish in bulk to sell. She uses her income to care for her children and pay other household expenses. With her profits from her expanded business, Afua plans to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, meat, and fish in bulk to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is divorced and has children.  She sells kenkey (a fermented corn and cassava dough that is wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and farmed products at Mbeam near Abura, which she has been doing for 20 years.  She received an education through middle form 4.  

Ama is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase bags of maize for her to produce kenkey in large quantities. She  is responsible for caring for her children and paying other household expenses. Ama hopes to use the profits to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has four children.  Her husband is a farmer.  Grace cooks rice and kenkey (a fermented corn and cassava dough that is wrapped in corn or banana leaves), which she serves with fried fish and vegetable sauce at  Kwalinkrom near Elmina.  Grace has had this business for three years.

Grace is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase bags of rice, maize, and fish required in preparing her food.  She uses her income to support her husband with the general upkeep of their children.  Grace hopes to use her profits from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, maize and fish.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana sells banku and waakye near Kwarhinkrom. Banku is cooked and fermented maize or cassava dough and waakye is rice and beans mixed together. 

Nana is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Nana has been selling banku and waakye for 20 years. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize and rice. 

She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and rice to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is married and has eight dependents.  She sells sheabutter, pomade, and powder, which she has been doing for 20 years. Her husband is a farmer. She lives in Kwahinkrom near Elmiina. 

Hawa is requesting a loan, which she will use to  purchase more sheabutter, pomade, and powder to sell.  She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family.

loans.use: to purchase sheabutter, pomade, and powder to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a can of oil and a bag of sugar.

loans.name: Matogoma

texts.fr:
Madame  Matogoma  est âgée de 28 ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle réside avec son époux à Lafiabougou, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Matogoma après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité de coupe et couture il y a onze années. Son atelier de couture se trouve au grand marché de Sikasso où elle dispose déjà 4 machines dont 2 machines de broderie et 2 machines simple. Madame Matogoma est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après deux prêts individuels bien remboursés, elle sollicite un troisième prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter des pièces de rechange pour ses quatre machines et 50 mètres de tissus pour en coudre et ensuite les revendre afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 F CFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Matogoma is 28 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband in Lafiabougou, one of the outlying districts of the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mail). Matogoma, having already tried several businesses without success, started her tailoring and sewing business 11 years ago. Her sewing workshop is located at the Sikasso Grand Market, where she already has 4 sewing machines, 2 of which are embroidery machines and 2 of which are simple sewing machines. Matogoma is much in demand by her clientèle because of the quality of her services.

In order to better satisfy her growing clientèle, Matogoma decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. After 2 individual loans which have been properly repaid, she is now requesting a 3rd individual loan which will enable her to buy some replacement parts for her 4 machines and 50 metres of fabric to sew and resell so that she can better respond to the expectations of her ever-growing customer base.

Matogoma expects to make a monthly profit of 200 000 francs most of which will be used to contribute to the family expenses and to pay the loan interest. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita. She previously accessed a 30,000-PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000-PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosita simply dreams to live peacefully with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her sidecar, room rentals, and additional stocks of vegetables

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort earns an income by selling shoes and slippers. She has been engaged in this business for the past five years. She lives with her husband and their four children at Kwahinkrom. Comfort's husband is a farmer, and she uses her income to support her husband in providing for the family's needs. 

Comfort will use her loan funds to purchase more shoes and slippers to offer for sale. 

With the new profit expected from the loan, she intends to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and slippers to offer for sale

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en: Anastacio is a 53-year old resident of Mamanga Gamay, Plaridel. He helps his family's needs from the little amount of 10,000 PHP he gains monthly from his banana/coconut production business, which he has operated for 3 years. However, this year he joined GDMPC, and he is applying for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Anastacio wants to make an expansion to his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more frozen fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to increase her stock of coconuts. The earnings created were a big help with the education of her children and with her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Nida would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy an additional stock of coconut needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nida hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more coconuts needed in her business.

loans.name: Valia

texts.en:
Valia, age 27, is a dairy famer. She lives with her husband and their two small daughters in Nasaguri, East Georgia. 

Valia is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has five milk cows. From their milk, she produces cheese and yogurt. Valia sells dairy products locally in an open market at a good price. She is a very hard-working young woman and has gained a great deal of valuable experience in her business. 

She has requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. Having an additional milk cow will allow her to produce more dairy products and thus increase her sales. This will significantly increase the income of the family, and they will be able to improve their living conditions. 

Valia is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1969 à Niangasso préfecture de Sikasso, Madame Korotoumou est mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle réside avec son époux à Hamdallaye  Sikasso Madame Korotoumou s’est initiée depuis plus de vingt années au domaine du commerce notamment à l’achat vente  des fruits  légumes et tubercules. Elle vend au nouveau de marché dont elle dispose une place où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Après un prêt individuel bien remboursé, elle est à son deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter un demi chargement de pick-up en banane plantain  et 10 sacs de pomme de terre.
Ses marchandises sont achetées sur place avec les paysans venus des villages environnants qui sont revendues sur places au marché des fruits et légumes du nouveau marché de Médine à une clientèle composée essentiellement de forains venus de partout.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 170 000 F CFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Korotoumou was born in Niangasso, Sikasso, in 1969.  She is married, has two children, and lives with her husband in Hamdallaye, Sikasso.  Korotoumou set up her business buying and selling fruit, veg and tubers more than twenty years ago.  She sells her produce from her stall in the market and she has a lot of demand from customers owing to the good quality of her goods.  In order to satisfy her ever-growing customer base, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution approximately one year ago.  Having paid back her previous individual loan on time and in full, she is now requesting her second loan which will allow her to increase her working capital and buy half a pick-up truck load of plantains and 10 sacks of potatoes.

Korotoumou buys her produce directly from farmers who come from surrounding villages.  She then re-sells the produce at the new Médine fruit and veg market.  Most of her customers are itinerant merchants and they come from all over.

With this loan, Korotoumou plans to make a monthly profit of 170,000 francs.  She will use this money to increase her working capital, cover family expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy plantains and potatoes

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a 43-year-old resident of Catadman, Ozamis City. She provides for her four children's needs from the little amount (5,000 PHP) she gains monthly from her own sari-sari store and the income her husband gets by driving. 

Earlier this year, she applied for a loan of 9,500 PHP from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy more items, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. She wants to improve her business one day.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys earns an income by running a provision kiosk near Kwarhinkrom. She has been selling provisions for four years. She and her husband have two children. Her husband is a farmer.

Gladys's loan funds will be used to buy provisions like milk, Milo, bread, and soft drinks to offer for sale. She intends to use the new profits expected from the loan to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: buy provisions like milk, Milo, bread, and soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Tseetuya

texts.en:
Mr. Tseetuya, 61 years old, lives with his wife and only son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in the ger district, a rural area where Mongolian traditional homes are built. As winter comes to Mongolia, it is a very hard living environment for most residents. 

Tseetuya’s wife works as a clerk in the National Supreme Court and his son, 35 years old, runs a business of a kiosk/small shop where some products are sold at a bus stop. Before retiring from work in 2011, Tseetuya had been working as a driver in a private company. Now he helps his son to run the kiosk business and is eager to see him reach success. 

In order to increase the current assets of the kiosk business, Tseetuya is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy some necessary stock such as soap, notebooks, sweets and breads. His only wish is to see his son living happily, and therefore he is eager to help his son in any way.

loans.use: to buy some necessary stock such as soap, notebooks, sweets and breads.

loans.name: Ernesto Isabel

texts.es: Ernesto Isabel de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia. Él se posee un taller de estructuras metálicas donde elabora bases para mosquitero, balcones para ventana, puertas entre otros, tiene varios años con su trabajo y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, sabe que es un negocio muy rentable y ya tiene mucha clientela, pues la materia prima es de primera calidad los precios por estructura muy accesibles y además con un servicio excelente, sus compradores siempre quedan satisfechos; Ernesto es un hombre honrado y muy trabajador, con muchos propósitos a futuro, piensa que para  tener éxito, debes saber qué estás haciendo, te debe gustar lo que estás haciendo y creer en lo que estás haciendo, el cree en su sueño de hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro por mayor. Ernesto Isabel tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ernesto Isabel, 43, lives with his life partner and child in his own house.  He has a metal shop where he makes bases for mosquito netting, window balconies, doors, and other metal structures.  He has done this work for several years, which has given him valuable experience that allows him to get the best profits.  He knows it's a very profitable business and he already has a lot of customers because his supplies are top quality, the prices per structure affordable, and the service excellent.  His buyers are always satisfied.

Ernesto's an honest and very hardworking man with many goals for the future.  He thinks that to be successful you should know what you're doing and like and believe in what you're doing.

He believes in his dream of making his business grow, so he's asking Integral for a loan to buy iron wholesale.

Ernesto Isabel has a good payment record and impeccable morals.  He is certain he'll be able to pay back the debt and hopes he'll also be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy iron wholesale

loans.name: Goysam

texts.fr: Goysam est une jeune femme de 23 ans. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'elle gère depuis 3 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son acceuiel chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'elle a acquise avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock d'huile de palme parce que c'est un produit très consommé par son entourage et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Goysam is a young, 23-year-old woman. She has opened a small food shop in a district of the capital which she has been running for 3 years already. Her small business works well thanks to her warm welcome, her experience in this line of work and the customer base which she has acquired over time. The number of the latter is becoming important, and she can no longer satisfy them due to her limited capital which forces her to buy her products retail. She is requesting this loan so that she can increase her inventory of palm oil, as it is a product much used by the people in her environment, and so that she can increase her profit margin. She will reinvest part of her profits into her business so that she can meet the needs of her customers, and the other part will enable her to meet her daily needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of palm oil.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es: Reina de la Paz de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee una tortillería  desde hace varios años y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa  que le permite elaborar las tortillas mas ricas y al mismo tiempo también obtiene el máximo de ganancia en las ventas, es muy conocida en el lugar y últimamente se ha aumentado la demanda pues su negocio se caracteriza por ser el servicio más rápido además las tortillas son ricas, calientitas y las vende a un precio muy accesible; Reina es una mujer muy carismática siempre se encuentra con una sonrisa en el rostro, dispuesta a trabajar, tiene muchos sueños que quiere alcanzar y uno de ellos es ver crecer su negocio y sabe que solo con mucha perseverancia y responsabilidad logrará llegar al éxito, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, gas propano. Reina de la Paz tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la ves tiene confianza que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Reina de la Paz is 46 and lives with her life partner and children in their own house. Over several years, she has operated and gained valuable experience at her tortilla stand that lets her produce delicious tortillas while garnering good profits from her sales. She is well known in the community, and recently, demand has increased because she provides the fastest service and her tortillas are tasty, warm, and affordable.

Reina always wears a smile, sets goals, and is charismatic and hardworking. One of her goals is to grow her business, which she realizes requires perseverance and responsibility, so she decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy wholesale corn and propane gas. Reina de la Paz has good credit references and impeccable character, and she promises to pay her debt on time. She is also confident that she can bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and propane gas.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 40 years old and married. She is from San Roque, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. 

She has three grown children who have helped her in taking care of their bananas. They have been raising bananas for three years and earn PHP 3,000 a month. 

Recently, Concepcion joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs. 

She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 20,000 PHP, to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Raquel dreams that all her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 35 years old and married with four children. Her spouse is a civil servant and supports her in providing additional income for the family. Nancy runs a general retail shop which has been operation for four years and earns her a monthly income of KES. 35,000.

She is borrowing her second loan of KES. 30,000 which she intends to purchase more stock like soap, sugar, rice, and flour for her business. 


She plans to use the additional income to plough back into the business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help him in ploughing and planting sugar cane.

loans.name: Florance

texts.en:
Florance is 41 years old and married to Musembi. Their children attend school.

Florance has been farming for about one year and has a monthly income of about 9500 KES.

She is taking a second loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer after successfully repaying the previous one. 

She hopes to expand her farm and give her children a good-quality education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 41-year-old carpenter in Mariakani, near Mombasa. He is married and he supports his family alone. He has been in the carpenter business for the last six years and he is doing well. 

Rashid will use the requested loan to purchase timber for his workshop and use the anticipated profit to repay his loan. This is Rashid's seventh loan. The previous loans were paid successfully. He hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase timber for his workshop.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg, 36 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house. Her husband works as a driver in a private company. Her elder son, 17 years old, studies in college while her second son goes to secondary school. The youngest son, 2 years old, remains at home. 

Since 2006, Erdenechimeg has been running a handicraft business. Its income greatly contributed to the living condition of the family, enabling them to buy furniture and other assets. The handicraft business involves the manufacture and scissoring of felt boots. The demand for felt boots is higher than for normal boots and meeting the demand is very hard for Erdenechimeg because she has no access to a sewing machine. 

So, she is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to purchase a sewing machine and raw materials. As a result, she can produce and scissor more felt boots, increasing her income, which will be used for her children’s future education.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and raw materials for her business.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, aged 33, is married with two children who rely on his income. San works as a construction foreman to support the food, home expenses, and allowance for one of his children. Working in the construction field for almost 10 years, San is able to generate approximately 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) each day. To add to his income, San’s wife sells snacks, sweets, pure drinking water, and study materials in a state school in their region, earning around $4.50 USD per day.

San would like to apply for a loan from HKL in order to purchase a motorcycle for his daily transportation needs. He usually goes to his workplace by hiring a taxi service, and it costs him a lot for this expense. He hopes that the loan will provide him a better lifestyle and will reduce his transportation fees. Therefore, San will save more for his family and the future education of his two children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his daily transportation needs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose. She previously accessed a 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rose simply wants to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 39-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She is the mother of three young children.  She has been running a sari-sari or variety store business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 

Marina is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, snack food, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store.

Marina dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like noodles,canned goods, snack food, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Al-Reem Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Reem, and it consists of five ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. All of the members are hardworking and know each other well. They took a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Eftkar is a 27-year-old, married woman who has two children. She owns a small house which does not look good. She is interested in raising her children and enrolling them in school. She intends to renovate her house. So, she applied for a youth loan of 40000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her home. She hopes to own a big house in which to live a happy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.name: Beata Josefina

texts.en:
Beata Josefina is from Catadman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Beata Josefina provides mechanical services to local community members. Beata Josefina has been engaged in her business for three years and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Beata Josefina joined GDMPC. Beata Josefina is requesting her third GDMPC loan, for 5,500 PHP, to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr: Jean Claude est un homme âgé de 31 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant d'un an. Il a aussi 3 autres personnes à sa charge.Il a ouvert une alimentation dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 1 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son acceuiel chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale,cartons de sucres), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Jean Claude is a 31 year old single man and father to one 1 year old child. He also has 3 other dependents. He opened a grocery store in a neighborhood of the capital which he has been managing for 1 year already. His little business functions thanks to his warm welcome, his experience in this domain and the clientèle which he gained with time. His clientèle is becoming large and he doesn't manage to satisfy it anymore due to his small capital which obliges him to buy retail. He is requesting this loan to strengthen his small business, to diversify his merchandise (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar), and be able to increase his profit margin. He will reinvest part of his profits in the business to cover the needs of his sector and the other part will allow him to meet his daily needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock (salt, rice, mineral water, and sugar).

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She cultivates rice, which she has been doing for four years.  She earns 5,000 PHP per month. 

Marites is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop.  She recently joined GDMPC. She plans to reinvest a portion of the income into her business for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coconut shells for making charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more DVDs and purified drinking water to resell.

loans.name: Umwete Group

texts.fr:
Diomède fait partie du groupe  Umwete et habite à Bujumbura. Il a 37 ans et est marié à Yvonne, une couturière. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de 3 à 11 ans, tous étudient.

Il  fait le commerce des boissons Primus, Amstel, limonade depuis 4ans.

Il est à son septième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de boissons Primus, Amstel, limonade, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter une parcelle et construire une maison, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Diomède is part of the group Umwete and lives in Bujumbura. He is 37 years old and is married to Yvonne, a seamstress. Together they have 4 children, aged from 3 to 11 years old.

He has been selling Primus, Amstel and lemonade drinks for 4 years.

He is on his seventh loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of Primus, Amstel and lemonade drinks, to resell to make more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land and build a house, and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of Primus, Amstel and lemonade drinks, to resell to make more.

loans.name: Octave

texts.fr: Marié, vivant avec sa femme et son seul enfant à Lomé, Octave est un homme âgé de 45 ans. Son enfant de 15ans est scolarisé. Il revend des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 1999 et son point de vente est situé à son domicile. Il sollicite son cinquième prêt auprès de WAGES pour  acheter une plus grande quantité de marchandise et agrandir son activité. Il désire assurer le bien être de sa famille et spécialement la scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en: Married and living with his wife and his only child in Lomé, Octave is a 45 year old man. His 15 year old child goes to school. Octave has been reselling general foodstuffs since 1999 and his point of sale is located in his home. He is requesting his fifth loan from WAGES to buy a larger quantity of merchandise and expand his business. He wants to ensure the well-being of his family and especially the schooling of his child.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Gabriela Martinez

texts.es: Gabriela de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia; Ella posee un chalet donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, pan, frijoles, arroz, leche, huevos, embutidos entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en una lugar que califico como muy bueno para comerciar, tiene mucha clientela pero últimamente ha aumentado la demanda pues comercia productos de primera calidad a precios bajos, además el servicio es inigualable; Gabriela es una mujer activa siempre pendiente de superarse en su trabajo, le gusta mantenerse adelante de la competencia y nunca fallarle a su clientela, su  más grande secreto para llegar al éxito es la motivación y ella  la tiene al cien por ciento es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  granos básicos, golosinas, pan, huevos productos instantáneos, bebidas etc. Gabriela tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle asu familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 54 and lives with her family in her own house. She has a stand where she sells staples, bread, beans, rice, milk, eggs, and sausages. She has run the business for several years, and she has garnered valuable experience that lets her earn better profits. The stand is located in a busy area and has many customers. Recently, demand has increased because she sells quality items at low prices and with unequaled service. 

Gabriela is energetic and always ready to succeed in business; she likes to stay ahead of the competition and satisfy her customers. Her secret for success is being 100% motivated. She is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy staple grains, sweets, bread, eggs, instant products, beverages, and more. Gabriela is responsible and has a good credit history. She promises to pay her debt and hopes that the loan will give her a way to offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, sweets, bread, eggs, instant products, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy noodles, soaps, cigarettes, etc., to sell in her kiosk.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is 52 years old and lives in the Kaspi District with her grown daughters. Several times, Nani has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly social assistance received from the local government since the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category.   

Nani requested a loan from Credo to start a trade business of clothing sales. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Nani will purchase clothes and bed-clothing in Tbilisi for wholesale prices and resell them in her village for a profit. It will be hard work for Nani, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. 

The increased profit will be reinvested in clothing trading to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and bed-clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coconuts to offer for sale

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna, age 22, is a dairy farmer. She lives with her mother, sister, and brother in the Gardabani district of East Georgia. 

Khatuna is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has three milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. She milks her cows and produces cheese, which she sells locally in an open market at a good price. She is a very hard-working woman and has gained a good deal of experience in her business. 

Khatuna has requested a loan in order to purchase hay for the cattle. With this store of hay, she will be able to provide the livestock with feed so that they can be properly nurtured during the winter. As the cattle will be fattening properly, they will produce more milk in spring. This will cause an increase in the overall family income. With increased income, Khatuna will be able to improve the family's living conditions.

Khatuna is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase hay in order to properly feed her cattle during the upcoming winter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria is married and has three children. She is 33 years old and resides in Mialen, Clarin. 

Ria raises pigs for sale to support her family's daily needs. Through this, she gains a monthly income of PHP 6,000. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

Recently, Ria joined GDMPC. She wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is from Kharagauli District, West Georgia. He is 29 years old and lives with his wife, parents, and three children. He works as a joiner locally and gets a small monthly income. The family is involved in the agricultural business. Specifically, they have a small dairy farm consisting of a calf and four milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese production. In addition, they grow different kinds of vegetables on the family-owned land. Part of the harvested production is sold at the local open market, and the rest is used for family needs. He runs an animal husbandry business as well and has 5 pigs. Lasha works hard, but the family still doesn’t have enough income for some savings and to improve their living conditions. According to government estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they get monthly social assistance.

With the received credit, Lasha will purchase pigs. He will place the pigs in a shed located in their yard, raise them, and after several months the family will be able to have piglets. This will increase the family's animal husbandry business and their income as well. With the increased income, Lasha will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Nandin-Erdene

texts.en:
Nandin-Erdene is a 22-year-old young lady entrepreneur who has been operating a pig husbandry business since 2005. She has 2 pigs and 3 piglets and also about 30 goats. She operates her business with special help from her brother, Jargalsaikhan.

She lives with her mother, sister and brother in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. This district lacks basic infrastructure. Her husbandry business is located in her yard in which the family lives. 

Nandin is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase three pigs. The per-pig cost is 1,000,000 MNT.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, age 59, earns her living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. She has operated her business for the last two years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. She and her husband have four children.
 
Irene was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan. She is requesting a loan in the amount of KES 20,000 in order to buy additional stock for her kiosk, such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions, which she will sell to her customers. Irene will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees, as well as to expand the business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may help uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her kiosk, such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Emerthe is 50 years old. She is married with seven children. Four of them attend school while the other three completed their high school. Her husband works as a mechanic. 

Emerthe sells foodstuff. She has requested a loan for buying more rice, potatoes, and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff for resale.

loans.name: Ahmat

texts.ru: Заботливый отец 7 детей, которого зовут Ахмат, нуждается вашей поддержки.  Ему  53 года. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, с которой живет уже много лет. Его жена учительница в средней школе и получает маленькую зарплату. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 8 лет назад он начал свой бизнес услугой таксиста. Он упорно работает и старается преподнести услуги на высшем уровне и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Его старшие дети тоже работают, однако Ахмат является основным кормильцем в семье. Его доход ели-ели хватает на жизнь и он не может сделать ремонт дома уже несколько лет, так как у него нет сбережения. Его дом очень старый и везде грязно и нет нормальной условия для проживания. Его умная жена посоветовала ему взять займ и сделать ремонт. Это идея стало основой, для того, чтобы Ахмат обратился в нашу организацию за займом на сумму 600 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина. Он является повторным клиентом и обещает погасить займ во время. Этот займ поможет малообеспеченной семье улучшить условия проживания. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется только на вас.
texts.en: A caring father of seven who is named Ahmat needs your support.  He is 53 years old and is married to a wonderful woman with whom he has lived for many years.  His wife is a high school teacher and earns a small salary.  With the goal of providing for his family's needs, Ahmat started a business eight years ago in which he provides a taxi service.  He works hard to give the best service so he can attract more clients.  His eldest children also work, but Ahmat is the family's main breadwinner.  His salary is barely enough to live on and he has not been able to make repairs on his home for a few years, as he has no savings.  His home is very old, dirty and has no normal living conveniences.  His clever wife suggested that he ask for a loan to make the repairs.  This idea was the reason why Ahmat came to our organization to ask for a loan of 600 US dollars to buy building materials like cement and wood.  He is a repeat client and promised to repay his loan on time.  This loan helps a low-income family improve their living conditions.  Ahmat awaits your kindness and is counting on you alone.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and wood for repairing his house.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим житель города Исфары. Ему 63 года. Он женат, у него 1 ребенок. Рахим 40 лет работает водителем. Сейчас он занимается извозом людей с одного региона на другой. Он берет кредит для ремонта своей автомашины.
texts.en: Rahim lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 63 years old and is married with one child.  Rahim has worked as a driver for 40 years.  Now he helps move people from one region to another.  He is asking for a loan to make repairs to his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is a 50-year-old widow who lives with her son, daughter, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren in outer ger district (which lacks basic infrastructure), outside of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. 

She supports her family by operating a clothing stall business at the largest outdoor market in the city. She first began her business in 1998 at a local market. Currently, she has 2.5 million MNT (Mongolian tugriks) in working capital. 

Now it’s the very high shopping season in our country. It’s the New Year holiday, thus, Narantuya wants to increase her working capital by purchasing a variety of clothes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell during the upcoming holiday season.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells vegetables like okro and also fried plantains at Kwarhinkrom, near Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Aba has been in this business for 4 years. She is supporting her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of vegetables, like tomatoes, okro, and peppers, to satisfy her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business

loans.use: buy a variety of vegetables, like tomatoes, okro, and peppers, to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married with 5 dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Aba cooks wakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves it with gari, macaroni, meat, and fish stew at Kwahinkrom near Elmina, which she has been doing for the past 7 years now. She supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Aba will use her loan to buy bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients. Aba will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Qurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Жена Курбонали занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Курбонали имеет среднее образование. Он более десяти лет занимается животноводством. В основном Курбонали разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Он берет кредит для закупа коров и бычков.
texts.en: Qurbonali lives in the Khuroson region.  He is 46 years old and is married with four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Qurbonali has a high school education and has been raising livestock for more than ten years.  He mainly raises large livestock at his own farm.  He is asking for a loan to buy cows and bulls.

loans.use: to buy cows and bulls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of sisal for sale.

loans.name: Maripet

texts.en:
Maripet is 36 years old, married and has been blessed with three children that he supports. He is a livestock keeper and has been in livestock farming for the last six years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

He is servicing his fourth loan of 80,000 KES from KADET LTD that he plans to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale. He intends to use the anticipated profits to add to his animals' numbers and pay school fees for his kids. 

His future dream is to prosper and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholus, age 29, is engaged in mixed farming. He has been in this business for the past four years. His monthly income is KES 50,000. He and his wife Noomali have two children. 
  
He is currently requesting his third loan from KADET in the amount of KES 60,000. The loan funds will allow him to prepare his land and obtain plant seedlings for the new crop.
 
He plans to use the anticipated profits from his business to diversify into livestock farming. 

Nicholus's primary goal is to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to prepare his land and obtain plant seedlings

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 34-year-old restaurant owner in Mombasa. He is married and he supports three people, with his wife providing additional income. He has been in the restaurant business for the past three years and he has done great. 


Moses will use the requested loan to purchase furniture for his restaurant. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business and repay his loan. 


This is Moses' third loan. The previous ones were repaid successfully. He hopes to grow wealthy and healthy.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his restaurant.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children; both of whom are in school. She owns a retail shop for selling wheat/maize flour, kerosene, cooking oils, sugar, etc. and the business has been operating for two years. Elizabeth started the business through her personal savings. She also has a charcoal business and is employed as a teacher.

Elizabeth learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is price fluctuations. She looks forward to owning a larger wholesale outlet.

Elizabeth is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy additional retail stock e.g. wheat/maize flour, kerosene, cooking oils, sugar, etc.. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her pay the loan.

loans.use: To buy retail stock e.g. wheat/maize flour, kerosene, cooking oils, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 47-year-old, married man from Ubay, Bohol. He earns a living through his food vending business. He has been in the barbecue business for almost 20 years now.

Noel is asking for a loan to buy additional food ingredients like meat, seasoning, cooking oil, rice and others. With this, he will be able to cater to more customers in his eatery. 

Noel hopes of expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional food ingredients like meat, seasoning, cooking oil, rice and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Liverson

texts.en:
Liverson is married and lives in Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. He owns a three wheeler vehicle commonly referred to as “tuk tuk.” He has been in the transportation business for three years. He aspires to earn additional income by setting up a broiler farm. 

Liverson is requesting a loan for 21,100 KES, which he will use to set up a poultry farm.  He will use the loan to build a poultry house and buy chicks, feeds, and feeding troughs.
