He learned about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is fluctuating fuel prices.  The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his living standard.  In the future, Liverson would like to own more three wheeler vehicles.

loans.use: to build a poultry house and purchase chicks, feeds, and feeding troughs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nadia. It consists of six women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. Together, they have requested a loan in the amount of 240,000 YER. 

Aziza, age 50 and widowed, is a member of the Nadia group. She has two children. She sells incense and perfumes to earn a living, and she has been operating her business for nine years. She started her business after her husband's death, and she pushes herself to work hard in order to provide for her children's needs. 

She has applied for a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy incense and perfumes to offer for sale. This loan will improve her business income and help improve her family's living standards. 

She hopes eventually to own a store where she can sell incense, perfumes, and cosmetic materials.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes to offer for sale

loans.name: Yao Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two partners residing at Teshie. They have been together for one year and doing very well. 

George, the leader, is 34 years old, married, and a business man. His wife is trader. He sells fishing equipments to the fishermen in and around his community, which he has been doing for seven years.  Cecilia, the other group member, sells provisions.

George is requesting a loan for 500 GHS, which he will use to buy more goods to sell.  The two members together need 1,000 GHS.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell to their customers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Kilifi, Kenya. He is a married businessman who sells firewood, a trade he has run for one year. Joseph has five children. 

Joseph learned of Milango Financial Services from a friend and he joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan of 15,850 KES (Kenya shillings) to buy firewood and also pay for its transportation. 

The only challenge in the business is the bad debts. Joseph is determined to carry out his operations well because he believes that it is from such a venture that he can establish his family. His future ambition is to be able to purchase a larger stock and also to set up a charcoal business.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale and to pay for its transportation.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 37 year old, married, and has four dependents.  She is a  shop retailer in Mombasa, which she has been doing for one year.  

Saida is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase stock for her store, such as cooking fat, sugar, bales of wheat flour, and maize flour.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, sugar, bales of wheat flour, and maize flour.

loans.name: Rokiatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Rokiatou a 26 ans, elle est mariée et  réside avec son époux et leurs trois  enfants à Wayerma II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Rokiatou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente des  friperies il y a plus de cinq ans. Elle mène son activité au marché de son quartier et souvent de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de quatre ans. Après 2 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier et un prêt individuel bien remboursé, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 5 balles de friperie de qualités différentes 
(respectivement: Tee-Shirt, habits pour enfants, Draps et Body). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place avec les grossistes avant de les revendre en détail.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rokiatou is 26 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and their three children in Wayerma II, one of the working-class neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

Mrs. Rokiato, having tried many businesses without success, learned this business purchasing and selling second-hand clothing more than five years ago. She runs her business at her neighborhood market and often as a traveling saleswoman in the city of Sikasso, where she is highly sought after by her customers for the quality of her products. In order to satisfy her ever-growing group of customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than four years ago. After two group loans in a group of women from her neighborhood and an individual loan that has been properly repaid, she is on her second individual loan.

With this loan, she plans to purchase five bundles of second-hand clothing of varying quality. (T-shirts, baby clothes, bed linens and lingerie, respectively.) She purchases her wares on site from wholesalers before reselling them at retail prices.

Mrs. Rokiato expects to see a monthly profit of 95,000CFA francs with this loan, which will be used to contribute to the family expenses, to pay the interest on her loan, and the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Cuando Ernesto terminó de prestar el servicio militar en el Ejercito de Colombia y no encontró un empleo,  decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios, pues necesitaba genera ingresos para responder a sus propios gastos y los de su familia; así fue como inició su negocio de venta de perros calientes  la que acompañó  con refrescos; poco a poco su clientela creció y fue agregando otros productos, como chorizos, chuzos y arepas , con los cuales  ha logrado sostenerse y han generado en él, un inmenso deseo de ampliar sus posibilidades de ganar mas dinero. Los fines de semana son las fechas en las  cuales sus ventas se incrementan y esto resulta porque las familias compran la comida elaborada, para que las mujeres del hogar descansen un poco de sus quehaceres de cocina. Él se está preparandose para las fiestas de navidades y año nuevo, temporada en la cual, hace su mejor venta, y no quiere que pase desapercibida para él, porque su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para tener inventarios de insumos, con los cuales fabricar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará carne de res, embutidos y salsas en mayor volumen,  para ganar descuentos por las compras de contado y en más cantidad. De esta manera su credikiva se hace exitoso,  porque favorece el desempeño de su negocio y aumenta sus posibilidades de ganar mucho mas dinero, con el cual tener un mejor estar.
texts.en:
When Ernesto completed his military service with the Colombian Army he was unable to find employment so decided to start his own business venture because he needed to generate income to cover his and his family’s expenses. This was how he started his hot-dog business that he added soft-drinks to.  Gradually his clientele grew and he started to add more products like sausages, skewered meat and arepas.  He’s been able to support himself this way and an enormous wish to widen his possibilities of earning more money has been born in him.  

Weekends are when his sales increase and this is because families buy ready-made food so the women of the house can rest a bit from their cooking chores.  He is preparing for the Christmas and New Year’s festivities which is the season when sales are the best.  He does not want to miss out on it because of insufficient capital to buy the necessary ingredients to make his products and increase sales.  

This is the reason why he’s turning to a Kiva loan to buy beef, sausages and sauces in larger amounts to qualify for volume and cash purchase discounts.  In this way his Kiva loan will be successful because it favors his business’ development and increases his possibility of earning much more money which will lead to better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beef, sausages and sauces in larger amounts.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora de 57 años de edad, tiene dos negocios,  por un lado un taller de confecciones, donde trabaja todas las líneas de ropa  y por otro lado una tienda donde comercializa  productos de la canasta familiar . Isidora como comerciante tiene 32 años de experiencia, desde que decidió buscar un trabajo independiente, para genera ingresos que beneficiaran su hogar y apoyar a su esposo, quien hasta ese momento respondía por los gatos de su hogar, en su inicial negocio de tienda, donde ella siempre trabajó en su compañía; desde hace un tiempo, decidió emprender una confección, nueva aventura de negocios, en compañía de su hija, fabricando en su propio taller y vendiendo directamente al consumidor final, mediante la promoción y desde su punto de exhibición. Los dos negocios ayudan a genera ingresos a su familia y ella se siente muy satisfecha por ello, pero las temporadas de fin de año, época de gran despliegue comercial, siente que es importante tener un capital e trabajo adicional, para surtir y responder a su clientela, que incrementa sus gastos en alimentos y en vestuarios, para recibir el año nuevo y las navidades, satisfechos y muy felices en familia. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos, accesorios femeninos, para dar un acabado especial a la ropa que hace y además requiere comprar ranchos, víveres, licores, refrescos y bebidas, importantes para dar gusto a su clientela mientras su familia con ello genera nuevos ingresos y hacen de Kiva su mejor inversión.
texts.en:
Isidora, 57, has two businesses.  On the one hand, a sewing workshop where she makes all types of clothes and on the other hand a store where she sells basic staple items.  Isidora has 32 years’ experience as a merchant ever since she decided to find independent work to generate income for her home and to help out her husband who was solely responsible for them up to then.

In her initial store business she always worked in his company and then some time later decided to start sewing, a new business venture, with her daughter.  She manufactures in her own workshop and sells directly to the final consumer by means of promotion and from her own display point.

The two businesses help her generate family income and she feels very satisfied because of it.  But, the end-of-year season mean a large upswing in commercial activity and she feels that it’s important to have additional working capital to stock up and respond to demand from customers who increase their purchases of food and clothing to celebrate Christmas and New Year’s.  

This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan to buy fabric, thread and women’s accessories to provide special finishing touches to the clothes she makes and she also needs to buy snacks, food items, liquor, soft-drinks and beverages that are important to satisfy her clientele while generating additional income for her family and making  Kiva her best investment.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies, women's accessories, snacks, food items, liquor, soft-drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Etilsa

texts.es: Etilsa de 44 años de edad, es la propietaria de una tienda en la que vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos y licores. Ella inició hace muchos años su actividad comercial, vendiendo ropa principalmente y calzado en la ciudad de Barranquilla y en su natal Sincé, población del departamento de Sucre, en la Región Caribeña de Colombia, donde viajaba regularmente a vender, alejándola un poco de su familia; hace 2 años decidió invertir los ahorros en una tienda de ranchos, víveres, refrescos y bebidas, para poder estar mas cerca de su hogar y continuar  generando ingresos, que beneficiaran a todos, pues no habían tiendas cercanas,  coyuntura que aprovechó para potencializar sus ventas y ganar clientela. Su negocio funciona en un Kiosco construido con cemento frente a su residencia su meta es continuar ampliándolo hasta convertirlo en un autoservicio, pero ubicado en otra comunidad en la que a futuro planea trasladarse. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres  como aceites, tubérculos, legumbres, cereales etc. Con su credikiva invertido en esta temporada asegura su éxito, por el gran movimiento comercial que se genera a finales de año, donde las comidas especiales ocupan el primer lugar, para compartir la mesa alrededor de las familias.
texts.en:
Etilsa, 44, owns a store where she sells food items, snacks, soft-drinks and liquor.  She started her commercial activity many years ago selling clothes and shoes primarily in the city of Barranquilla and in her birthplace, Sincé, a town in Sucre Department in Colombia’s Caribbean Region where she’d go to regularly to sell and which meant separations from her family.  

Two years ago she decided to invest her savings in a store selling snacks, food items, soft-drinks and beverages so she could be closer to home and continue earning income for everyone’s benefit since there were no nearby stores, a juncture she took advantage of to make her sales and secure clientele.  Her business operates in a cement kiosk in front of her house and her goal is to continue expanding it until it becomes a self-service but locating in another community she plans to move to.  

She’s applying for a Kiva loan, her first Fundación Mario Santo Domingo financing, to buy food items like oil, tubers, vegetables, cereals, etc.  Investing her Kiva loan this season guarantees success because of the intense commercial activity that takes place at the end of the year where special meals shared at table with family occupy center stage.

loans.use: to buy food items like oil, tubers, vegetables, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Fanis

texts.es: Fanis de 47 años de edad se dedica al comercio de abarrotes, ranchos, víveres y refrescos, desde hace 3 años; ella inicialmente se dedicaba a la venta de jugos elaborados con frutas naturales de cada cosecha y fue agregando poco a poco otros artículos,  hasta convertirlo en un estadero, que finalmente debió vender, junto a su vivienda, debido a la enfermedad de su hijo menor, por lo cual se mantuvo un tiempo sin negocio, para poder atender su dificultad en salud. Su negocio actual, fue producto de una oportunidad en la que redescubrió hace 3 años, nuevamente su ejercicio comercial acostumbrado y con ello hoy apoya la gestión de su hogar. Sus ventas las realiza en un punto comercial ubicado en su domicilio, de manera directa al consumidor detallista, mientras realiza las compras en empresas mayoristas, que le ofrecen mejores precios, descuentos especiales y la seguridad y garantía de los artículos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado aceite, arroz, pastas y azúcar, con ello logrará fortalecer su negocio, ofreciendo una variedad de productos en sus inventarios, para responderle al cliente tal como ellos se lo merecen y ella ganar un poco mas, generando éxito en la inversión de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Fanis is 47 years old and has a shop where she has been selling groceries, snacks, food, and soft drinks for three years. She started out selling natural juices made from fruits that were harvested each season, but she gradually began selling other items. Her business was converted into a store, which she had to sell along with her home because of her young son’s illness. She did not have time to manage a business since she had to attend to her son’s health issues.

Her current business resulted from an opportunity presented to her three years ago and now it enables her to provide for her household. Her sales are conducted from a shop that is located in her home and it allows her to have direct contact with her customers. Fanis buys her products from wholesalers that offer the best prices and discount specials. They also guarantee that they will have products in stock.

At the moment, Fanis is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can buy products in bulk and with cash such as oil, rice, pasta, and sugar. This will strengthen her business and provide a variety of products for her inventory so that she can respond to her customers with what they need. She will generate more income, thus resulting in a successful investment of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, pasta, and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es: Rosa con su confección está muy feliz, porque ha logrado hacer inversiones de capital de trabajo a él negocio, gracias a su credikiva, que le ha permitido comprar materias primas e insumos y hacer mantenimiento preventivo a sus maquinarias; ella logró terminar de confeccionar prendas sobre un pedido importante y mejorar sus tiempos con la adecuación de su infraestructura técnica y esto fue gracias a su credikiva. Su nivel de vida ha aumentado debido a su trabajo y ahora su capacidad de compra aumenta cada vez más. En el mes de Diciembre, se acercan las festividades, en las cuales todas las familias desean estar muy elegantes para esperar las navidades y el año nuevo, sus pedidos son nuevamente superiores a su capacidad de compra y por esto acude nuevamente a un credikiva, con el cual comprará telas, hilos, en mayor volumen y también planea hace adecuaciones locativas en su taller. Rosa envía el siguiente mensaje: “Doy gracias a Dios por Kiva y por tener la oportunidad que me han brindado de pertenecer a la gran familia microempresarial Santo Domingo, y por ese apoyo que siempre he recibido cuando lo necesito. “
texts.en:
Rosa is very pleased with her dressmaking business, because thanks to her Kiva loan, she was able to invest working capital in the business, enabling her to purchase raw materials and supplies and do preventative maintenance work on her machines.  She managed to complete the production of garments to fill an important order and improve her production times, thanks to the Kiva loan that allowed her to improve the technical infrastructure of her business.  Her standard of living has increased as a result of her work, and now her purchasing power is growing by the day.  

The festivities that take place in the month of December are approaching; this is a time when all of the families want to look very elegant as they await  Christmas and the New Year.  Her orders now exceed her purchasing capacity, and so for this reason she is seeking a Kiva loan once again.  With this loan, she will buy fabric and thread in bulk, and she also plans to make some improvements to her workshop.  

Rosa sends the following message: "I give thanks to God for Kiva, and the opportunity that they have provided me to belong to the great small-business family of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and for the support that I have always received when I have needed it."

video.title: Kiva Borrower Rosa Victoria from Colombia

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread in bulk, and also to make some improvements to her workshop

loans.name: Kulnara

texts.ru: Кулнара 49 лет, вдова. Она с мужем начали  занимается животноводством последний 20 лет назад, начав этот бизнес с 7,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Кулнара в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова, 27 голов овец, 2 лошади и 15 коз. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 9,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулнара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм. Доходы от кредита Кулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины. В будущем планирует отремонтировать хоз постройки дома.
texts.en:
Kulnara is 49 years old and a widow. She and her husband started working with livestock breeding 20 years ago, after having started this business with 7,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Kulnara currently has one dairy cow, 27 sheep, 2 horses and 15 goats on her farm. The monthly income from the business is 9,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kulnara turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock for fattening. Kulnara plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of farm animals. In the future, she plans to repair the home of the household.

loans.use: to purchase one bull and sheep

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a petty trader. She sells jewelry, such as earrings, necklaces, and beads, and cosmetics at Kwahinkrom, near Elmina, which she has done for 8 years now. She is a widow and has 4 children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay school fees for her children. Esi will use her loan to purchase more jewelry and cosmetics to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is 49 years old. She lives with her son and mother-in-law in a small village of Gardabani District, East Georgia. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. Specifically, they have 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Besides that, they have 20 beehives and sell honey. Maia is a very hardworking woman and has a wealth of experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing hay for the cattle. After purchasing hay, Maia will ensure the livestock are fed properly in wintertime. As the cattle will be fattening properly, they will get more milk in spring. This will cause an increase in the family income. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Maia awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cattle.

loans.name: Marlen

texts.es: Cuando el esposo de Marlen, perdió su empleo en una empresa, buscó alternativas de generar ingresos y encontró la posibilidad de trabajar con su esposa, en un lugar muy concurrido, ubicado frente a uno de los más importantes cementerios de la ciudad, cerca al corredor  de una vía preferencial muy reconocida en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí emprendió su negocio de vender jugos naturales  en un carro ubicado en el parque, donde hoy Marlen y su esposo se turnan para atender  la gran demanda de su clientela pues trabajan en horarios extendidos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche o mas tarde si en ese espacio se realizan los famosos torneo de futbol de adultos. Marlen prepara los mas deliciosos jugos naturales, aprovechando la temporada de cada fruta, así cualquier persona que se acerca bajo el incesante sol de la ciudad, puede consumir jugo de mango, banano, tomate de árbol, zapote, níspero, naranja, entre las deliciosas frutas Colombianas, de la que día a día regala la naturaleza a esta región. En la actualidad Marlen está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque requiere comprar en mayor volumen nuevas frutas de la época, como uvas, además de las que usualmente compra, preparándose para las fiestas de año nuevo, ofreciendo a sus clientes uvas, con las cuales  celebrar el fin de año, guardando las tradiciones de comer  12 uvas, por parte de cada miembro de la familia, antes de las 12 de la noche del 31 de Diciembre, momentos en los cuales las mujeres y los hombres, se abrazan y besan, cantan y brindan  llenos de felicidad, pidiendo a Dios su mayor deseo para el año venidero.
texts.en:
When Marlen’s husband lost his job in a firm he looked for alternatives for generating income and found the possibility of working with his wife in a very busy spot located across from one of the city’s most important cemeteries near a very well-known main avenue in Barranquilla.  He stared a business there selling natural fruit juices in a cart located in the park where now Marlen and her husband  take turns to meet the large customer demand because they work extended schedules from 6 in the morning until 7 at night or sometimes even later if it’s during the famous adult soccer tournaments.

Marlen makes the delicious natural juices taking advantage of each fruit’s season so that anyone approaching under the relentless sun in the city can consume mango, banana, tomato, sapote, loquat and orange juice among the delicious Colombian fruits that nature provides daily in this region.

Marlen is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because she wants to buy larger amounts of new seasonal fruit like grapes in addition to those she usually buys getting ready for the end of year festivities and offering grapes to her customers that are used for the traditional celebration at the end of the year when the custom is for each family member to eat twelve grapes before midnight on December 31st.  This is a moment when women and men hug and kiss, sing and share toasts full of happiness asking God for their greatest wish for the New Year.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Roland Hugues

texts.fr: Hugues est un jeune homme  de 25 ans commerçant. il fait la vente en détail des fruits( pommes de France)  dans un marché de la place depuis 2 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'il a acquis au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Il souhaiterai augmenter son stock de pomme pour avoir un bon stocks et élargir son réseau de ventes. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle, d'éviter les ruptures de stocks et d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Roland Hugues is a young, 25-year-old man and a fruit-seller. He has been selling apples ("pommes de France") at a local market for 2 years. He knows the suppliers well and knows the customers that he has acquired over time, thanks to his experience in his line of work, very well. 

He would like to increase his stock of apples so that he can have a healthy inventory and expand his sales network. This would allow him to satisfy the constant demand of his customers, to avoid stock shortages and to increase his profit margins. He will save his profits so that he can not only expand his business, but also meet his needs.

loans.use: to increase his stock of apples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a petty trader who sells food items such as cassava, plantains, and tomatoes. She offers her wares for sale at Besease near Elmina. Esi has been engaged in this business for the past eight years.

Esi and her husband have five children. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in paying the household bills. 

She will use her loan to purchase more food items to offer for sale. With the expected profits, she intends to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food items such as cassava, plantains, and tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Jeicy

texts.es: Jeicy de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia; ella posee una venta de artículos de uso personal como cremas, lociones, carteras, cosméticos entre otros, ya tiene mucho tiempo con el negocio y ha adquirido valiosa experiencia que le permite mejorar sus ventas y al mismo tiempo obtener el máximo de ganancias, comercia desde su casa o de forma ambulante, últimamente se ha hecho de muchas más clientela pues todo el producto que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, la amabilidad ante todo; Jeicy es una mujer muy laboriosa , le gusta luchar por sus sueños, piensa que la persona no se puede poner ningún límite, porque  no hay nada imposible si se trabaja duro, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cosméticos, cremas, perfumes, carteras, sandalias etc. Jeicy tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Jeicy is 29 years old and lives with her family in their own home.  She sells personal products such as creams, lotions, wallets and cosmetics, among others.  She has been in this business for some time and has gained valuable experience that allows her to improve her sales and at the same time maximize her profits.  She sells from her home or travels to other places, recently adding many more customers.  All of her products are of high quality and she sells them at affordable prices.  Moreover, her service is unbeatable, with kindness first and foremost.

Jeicy is a very hardworking woman who likes to fight for her dreams.  She believes that a person cannot place any limits on her dreams, because nothing is impossible if one works hard.  For this reason she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that would allow her to buy cosmetics, creams, perfumes, wallets and sandals, among others.  Jeicy has good credit references and impeccable character.  She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan and she has faith that in this way she will be able to bring economic security to her home and improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams, perfumes, wallets and sandals.

loans.name: Sugir

texts.en:
Sugir, age 39, lives with her husband and their four sons in the outer "ger" district of the city of Ulaanbaatar. Sugir's husband was working as a builder, but there is currently no building work, so he is staying at home. Sugir has therefore decided to buy an old taxi vehicle, and she plans to start a taxi business in which her husband will serve as the driver.  

This loan will be used to buy the taxi car with which Sugir and her husband will start up the business.

loans.use: to buy an old taxi car with which to start up a new taxi business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 32 year old single lady, who supports her brother.  She has been offering tailoring services for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 

She has applied for a loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD.   She will purchase stocks of fabric for dress making, and will will reinvest the profits into her business for expansion.  Her future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy clothing fabrics for her tailoring business

loans.name: Kamanza

texts.en:
Kamanza is a resident of Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married businessman with five children. Kamanza owns a retail shop, a business that he has been running for two years. Kamanza began the business through the savings he made from casual jobs. In this shop, he sells paraffin, sugar, flour etc.

He learnt about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. The main challenge is high competition and bad debts. Kamanza is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase paraffin, sugar, flour, bread, milk etc for sale at his shop. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his standard of living. He aspires to own other centers and plan for his children’s education with much security.

loans.use: To purchase paraffin, sugar, flour, bread, milk etc for sale.

loans.name: Génevierve

texts.fr: Genévierve est une femme de 49 ans divorcée mère de 2 enfants de 26 et 28 ans . elle a aussi 3 autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( tomate, obergines, poivrons et condiments verts) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 15 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constemment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai augmenter son stock de cajots de tomates pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Genévierve is a 49-year-old woman who is divorced and the mother of 2 children aged 26 and 28. She is also responsible for 3 other people. She is a small trader and has been selling seasonal fresh food (tomatoes, aubergines, peppers and green condiments) retail at a local market for 15 years. She knows the suppliers well and knows the customers that she has acquired over time, thanks to her experience in her line of work, very well. Unfortunately, she suffers from constant inventory shortages because she is forced to sell all of her stock before she can buy new produce, due to her limited capital. 

She would like to increase her stock of crates of tomatoes, which would enable her to better satisfy the constant demand of her customers and to avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits so that she can not only expand her business, but also meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of tomatoes.

loans.name: Rikard

texts.en:
Rikard is a hardworking and ambitious, twenty-one year old single male. He lives in a southern part of Kosovo with his entire family. Over three years ago, he stared his own business, a Caffe. At the very beginning he started with a very small Caffe and now has managed to grow it bigger. He has many customers and he is very satisfied with the income that he earns from his business.

Now Rikard's caffe needs renovation, but he does not have enough money to do so. He is therefore requesting a loan to be able to complete this project which he believes, will result in a growing customer base. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business to make it a big restaurant. His goal is to save the money for his future. He would like to thank all Kiva lenders for helping him!

loans.use: Renovating his caffe

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 48 years old and deals in farming to meet his family needs.  He grows cabbages and rears cattle to get income that sustains the livelihood of his household.  With the loan, he will buy fertilizer that will provide fertile soils to improve and increase the quality of his yields.  His clients are the community members and highway travelers, his challenge is limited capital, bad weather and stiff competition.  He is hard working and trustworthy.  In the photograph, John is on the left in his cabbage garden, with Ambrose, the Ugafode credit officer, during site visitation.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer and rent more farm land

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: El Sr. Fredy se dedica al armado de distintas estructuras de metal en su    cerrajería, su taller se encuentran en la zona  de la 16 de Julio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Fredy utilizara  este préstamo para compra de arco y oxigeno por su taller, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de agrandar su negocio con la compra de herramientas de trabajo, El Sr. Fredy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existen varias cerrajerías y los problemas sociales ya que existen bloqueos de calles y esto  no les permite tener clientes, y  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando sus herramientas y negocio. El Sr. Fredy es una persona joven y trabajadora su deseo es crecer en su taller  e ir mejorando su negocio día a día para así generar mayores ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy makes a living assembling different metal structures in his locksmith's shop. His workshop is found in the 16th of July zone. This loan is his first cycle with the institution. 

Fredy will use this loan for the purchase of an arc (a welding machine) and oxygen for his studio. The reason for requesting this loan is the necessity to expand his business through the purchase of tools for his work. Fredy faces challenges in his business, which include competition from various locksmiths located in his zone and social problems which cause street blockades that make it difficult for him to have clients. He will use the profits to continue improving his tools and his business. 

Fredy is a young and hardworking person with a wish to grow his studio and improve his business day by day, and in that way generate more income to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy an arc and oxygen for his metal-works studio

loans.name: Sarbinas

texts.ru: Сарбинос 43 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Сарбинос начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с 10,000 сом (KGS) купив 5 голов маленьких телят в 1998 году, хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. Благодаря упорному труду Сарбинос, ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 коровы,20 овец. По мимо этого она обрабатывает 0,4 га землю где ежегодно сажает картофель, фасоль.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сарбинос обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков и 15 овец по более низкой цене для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Сарбинос планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес за счет увеличения поголовья скота. В её планах в будущем построить  дать образование сыну и построить большой дом.
texts.en:
Sarbinas is 43 years old, married, and has two children. In search of a main source of income for the family, Sarbinas starting working with livestock breeding. After having started with 10,000 som (KGS) to purchase 5 small bulls in 1998, the farm currently bring sin around 15,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products and the reselling of livestock. Thanks to Sarbinas' hard work, her farm today counts 2 cows and 20 sheep. In addition to this she processes 0.4 hectares of land where she plants potatoes and beans every year. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Sarbinas turned to the organization "Bai Tuhsum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of 2 bulls and 15 sheep at a very low price, for fattening and reselling. Sarbinas plans to invest the income in further developing her business through an increase in livestock. In the future she plans to give her son an education and build a large house.

loans.use: To purchase 2 bulls and 15 sheeps

loans.name: Heberildo

texts.es:
El señor Heberildo tiene 56 años es de profesión taxista  y su esposa la señora Leonida es comerciante, el matrimonio tiene dos hijas adolescentes estudiantes, su esposa vende calzados en el centro de la ciudad y el Sr. Heberildo cuenta con parada de taxis  hace mas de 4 años.
El Sr. Heberildo y su esposa siempre se han esforzado por dar a sus hijas todo lo que pueden, pues quieren que ellas sean personas profesionales, que ayuden a los demás.
El solicita el crédito para reparar su taxi, ya que este es su medio de trabajo y quiere poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Heberildo, 56, is a taxi driver by profession and his wife, Leonida, is a merchant.  The couple has two teenage daughters who are students.  His wife sells footwear in the center of the city and Heberildo has had a taxi stand for more than four years.

Heberildo and his wife always have made the effort to give their daughters everything they can because they want them to be professional people who help others.

He's requesting the loan to repair his taxi because it's his means of work and he wants to be able to give his customers good service.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Las 15 integrantes de este grupo son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Caacupé, una de ellas es la Sra. Irene, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chipa, el cual es un alimento típico paraguayo parecido al pan.
Irene todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano y luego sale a vender sus chipas, es muy sacrificada, y tiene un gran espíritu de superación y de querer salir adelante. Comenta Irene que desde siempre tuvo que trabajar y que no teme a ningún desafío.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar harina de maíz, queso, anís, huevo, grasa de cerco y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo y vendiendo sus ricas chipas.
texts.en:
The 15 members of this group are friends and neighbors from the city of Caacupé.

One of them is Señora Irene, whose work is making and selling chipas (cheesy buns), which are a typical Paraguayan food similar to bread. Every day Irene begins to work very early and then goes out to sell her chipas. She is a very sacrificing person, and she has a great spirit of overcoming and wanting to advance. Irene comments that she has always had to work and that she doesn't fear any challenge.

She is applying for this loan to be able to buy corn meal, cheese, anise, eggs, lard, and other ingredients to be able to continue making and selling her delicious chipas.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal, cheese, anise, eggs, lard, and other ingredients to make cheesy buns

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 30-year-old greengrocer and retail shop owner in Mombasa. She is married and supports one person. She has been in this business for the past year, and she is doing great.

She will use the requested loan to purchase stock for her shop, like maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, cooking fat, vegetables, and fruits. And she will use the anticipated profit to expand her shop. 

This being her third loan -- the previous ones were paid successfully -- she hopes to prosper in her family life.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store and greengrocery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another plane, timber, and nails.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
This is Crisanta, 50, a resident of Malibay, Philippines. She is married to Bonifacio, a carpenter, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Crisanta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 23,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Crisanta hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupyry  es de la ciudad de Santaní, está integrada por 10 señoras muy emprendedoras actualmente están en el 2º ciclo y todas hacen actividades para mejorar su economía familiar. Todas ellas se dedican a la costura y tienen su máquina industrial. El crédito que Solicitan lo quieren invertir en la compra de telas y otros elementos.
La señora Gregoria, una de las miembros, es una señora muy trabajadora que empezó con la costura hace varios años y necesita el crédito para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Kuña Katupyry Communal Bank, in the city of Santaní, is made up of ten very enterprising women.  Currently they're in their second cycle.  They all do jobs to improve their family finances.  All of them make a living sewing and have their industrial machine.

The loan they're requesting is to invest in buying fabric and other items.

Gregoria, one of the members, is a very hardworking woman who began with sewing several years ago.  She needs the loan to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other items

loans.name: Uuganjargal

texts.en:
Uuganjargal is a 31 years old married lady who has son and daughter and lives with her family in outer Ger district of the city.  Her children attend local primary school and kindergarten while their father works at a private company. 

Uuganjargal supports her family by operating a clothing stall business at the largest outdoor market of Ulaanbaatar city. 
She is requesting a 1.500.000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and wallets to sell.

loans.name: Joe Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two partners Jonathan and Gladys. They have been together from 2010.

Gladys is a 42 year old trader, married to Israel, 53 years old, and they have children. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and doing very good with both her business and family.   She has been selling cosmetics and ladies bags for seven years. She hawks from Mondays through to Saturdays, a routine she has gone through with her mother but with her savings thanks to ID Ghana, she was able to build a store where she now sells. 

Thanks to ID Ghana’s training on savings, she has made it this far. She has been able to, thanks to this business and with the help of her husband, to educate their children up to the high school level. 

Jonathan deals in electrical parts.

This is Gladys's 5th loan and she needs GHS 950 to buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers.   They need a total amount of GHS 1,250 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells  vegetables like pepper and she is also food vendor.  She cooks rice and beans stew for sale at  Besease, near  Elmina.  Ekua is married  and has 6 children.  She has been in this business for 6 years.  She uses her income to  support her husband to feed their children.  Ekua  will use her loan to purchase vegetables like pepper, bags of rice and beans to prepare her food to sell.  With the new profit,  Ekua  plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables like pepper, bags of rice and beans to prepare her food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy essential materials for his tailoring business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi earns a living by selling slippers and rice in the town of Besease. She is married and the mother of three children, and has been in this business for 10 years while her husband works in electronics.  Esi uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. She will use this loan to buy more slippers and bags of rice to sell. With the additional profit she earns, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more slippers and bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar is a farmer with 11 years experience in breeding livestock. The main scope of his work is selling milk products. He is married and has two sons aged 19 and 20 years. Mukhtar would like to develop his business, so that this business gives a good income and security for his children. 

With the loan received, he plans to purchase livestock with its calf. He thanks VFAC and Kiva in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase livestock with its calf.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells maize porridge and bread, she also operates a grocery shop at Besease near Elmina.   The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft  drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish,  biscuit, toffees, powdered milk  etc.   Esther is married to a farmer and has 5 children.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills.  Esther will use her loan to purchase maize, flour and variety of groceries to sell at her shop.  With the new profit, Esther will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase maize, flour and a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more cosmetics and cloth to sell.

loans.name: Naba Al-Hayah Group

texts.en: This group is called Naba Al-Hayah and it is made up of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. Halima is 30 years old, married and works hard at her job as a tailor. She is a professional and her work has attracted many customers. She is requesting a youth loan for 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a sewing machine that works well and will allow her to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica  is a seamstress and also sells cosmetics, underwear, ladies and children items at Besease near Elmina.  She has been in this business for 12 years. She is married to a fisherman and has 1 child.  Veronica uses her income to assist  the husband in paying their accommodation and utility bills.  She will use her loan to purchase more underwear, cosmetics, ladies and children items to sell.  She will use her new profit to get a shop for her business.

loans.use: purchase underwear, cosmetics,  ladies and children items to sell

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, además de ser alegre y cordial. Es viuda del  padre de sus hijos quienes ya son independientes, por quienes se esforzó en sacar adelante a pesar de la adversidad. Vive  cómodamente instalada en su propia casa que compró con el fruto de sus esfuerzos, en compañía de sus inquilinos.
La actividad que realiza Celina es la venta de hojas secas de hirapay que es una palmera amazónica, estas hojas son usadas para el techado de las casas, las cuales almacena en su casa y los vende en la vía pública en un espacio  en la vereda de la pista transitada, sus clientes la visitan buscando estas hojas que tienen gran demanda y la buena atención que les brinda.
Se inició hace más de 01 año con un préstamo particular y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y una persona que paga por semana.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja.
Por otro lado cuenta  que decidió empezar esta actividad por idea de su socio quien se encarga de la extracción de estas hojas desde el interior de la selva, además vio que dejaba mayor ganancias.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar y aumentar su inversión en el negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 06 con la institución MFP. Por tanto cuenta  con  su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y solidario
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad en la extracción de las hojas de hirapay, buscando minimizar gastos y lograr sacar la mayor cantidad posible de hojas, para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Celina, who is 52, is a hardworking and determined woman with a strong desire to succeed.  What is more, she is cheerful and friendly.  She is a widow and the children she had with her late husband are now independent.  It was for their sake that she strove to succeed in the face of adversity and it was the fruits of these efforts which enabled her to buy her own home, where she lives comfortably along with her tenants.

Celina's business is selling dried hirapay (an Amazonian palm) leaves which are used for roofing houses.  She stores them in her house and sells them in the street on the pavement of the busy road.  Her customers visit her to obtain these leaves, which are in great demand, and because of the good service which she provides.  She set up her business over a year ago with a personal loan and, so far, has been able to rely on the help of her children and one other person whom she pays weekly.  She considers her business to be quite profitable on account of the earnings which it brings in.  Furthermore, she says that she got the idea of starting the business from her partner, who organises the harvesting of the leaves from the rain forest, and saw that it made higher profits.

Now, therefore, having seen the good results she has achieved, she plans to continue and increase her investment in the business.  This will involve obtaining a sixth loan from MFP, whose support she believes she can count on to pursue her goals.  What is more, she is once again committed to making all her repayments, as she did in the case of her previous loans.  She is happy with her communal bank which she considers to be a unified and caring group.  The 1,000 nuevos soles which she is applying for will be used in its entirety to harvest hirapay leaves, whilst minimising costs and attempting to harvest the greatest quantity of leaves possible, and thereby make higher profits.

loans.use: to buy hirapay leaves

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol de 30 años es natural de Santa Rosa comparte una vida conyugal con Misael de 32 años, como producto de su vida marital tiene hoy a  sus dos hijos Milena y Juan.
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo constante logro junto a Misael adquirir una vivienda a base de madera. Luego de culminar sus estudios como enfermera fuera de su localidad decidió retornar a su natal Santa Rosa con el objetivo de servir a su gente, es por ello que desde hace 7 años viene laborando el centro de salud público haciendo honor a su vocación de servicio y siendo una participe del desarrollo social de su localidad.
Al ser una persona muy dedicada a su labor apoya ocasionalmente también en centros y policlínicos particulares de su localidad logrando obtener así generar ingresos adicionales para su economía familiar.
Haciendo caso de su instinto micro-empresarial a optado por ingresar al rubro comercial consistente en la venta de calzados por catálogo que planea ofrecerlos a los empleados y trabajadores particulares con quien tiene constante contacto, es por ello que para desea contar con capital de trabajo que le permite adquirir el primer lote de calzados y la compra de los catálogos, esperando así obtener ingresos adicionales.
Tiene el deseo de a futuro aperturar una farmacia en la cual pueda seguir desempeñando su labor como protectora de la salud social y así consolidarse para brindarle a sus pequeños un mejor futuro. Lleva consigo 3 créditos. Gracias a su labor abnegada cuenta con un gran empleo que le permite obtener un ingreso fijo mensual  y cumplir de manera fluida con el pago de sus cuotas. Se siente muy comprometida con el trabajo que vienen desarrollando sus compañeros de su banco comunal puesto que siente mucha confianza.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles incursionará en la venta de calzados por catálogo realizando la compra de un lote de calzados y los respectivos catálogos.
texts.en: Marisol is thirty years old and comes from Santa Rosa. She lives in a civil union with Misael, who is thirty-two. They have two children, Milena and Juan. Thanks to her constant efforts, together with her husband, Marisol managed to buy a house made of wood. After graduating as a nurse in the city, she decided to come back to her hometown in order to help people. She has been working at the public health centre in Santa Rosa for seven years, honouring her promise to herself by being an active participant in her town's social development. As she is very dedicated to her work, she also helps sometimes at private health centres and clinics of her area, which helps her generate more income, which goes toward household expenses. Following her business instincts, she decided to start selling shoes from a catalogue. Her idea is to sell them to colleagues and to the other professionals she works with on a regular basis. In order to do that, she wants working capital with which to buy the first bulk of shoes as well as the catalogues, an activity that would generate additional income. In the future, Marisol would like to open a pharmacy, in order to keep helping people protect their health while generating more income to give her little ones a brighter future. This would be her fourth loan. Her sparing no efforts means that her position is stable and that she can count on her monthly salary to reimburse her loans seamlessly. Marisol feels a strong bond with the other members of her communal bank and says that everyone trusts each other. With this loan, she will buy shoes to sell from a catalogue and start her business in this field.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline Patricia

texts.es:
Jacqueline 29 años de edad, originaria de Managua, casada, madre de 1 hijo de 5 años, el cual cursa el preescolar de primaria, de oficio comerciante. Actualmente es dueña de un Cyber. Ella  inicio  su negocio atraves de una idea que le dio su esposo de comprar unas computadoras que estaban vendiendo en oferta, ya que el dueño del Cyber se iba del país, por eso la estaba vendiendo y fue ahí que aprovecharon la oportunidad de comenzar con su propio  negocio, del que es dueña desde hace 5 años, este ha sido su primer negocio.
Sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio  y agregar otros productos que le  gustaría vender. 

Ademas de comprar computadoras, ella quiere comprar  otros productos adicionales para agregar a su negocio,   como perfumes, celulares y joyas de plata, etc. De esta manera poder  diversificar su negocio. Ya que ella estima que el préstamo le  ayudaría a superar sus ventas, y con las ganancias que obtenga invertir en otros productos que aun no tiene en inventario. Sus planes futuros es cambiar sus computadoras, para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 29, was born in Managua, is married, and is a merchant and mother of a 5-year-old son who attends preschool. She owns an Internet café Cyber, a business she started after her husband suggested she buy some computers that were on sale after the owner of Cyber left the country. She took that opportunity five years ago to start her first business. She expects to grow the business and add other items to sell.

In addition to buying computers, she wants to to buy more items such as perfumes, cell phones, and silver jewelry to sell so that she can diversify her business. She believes the loan will help her increase sales, and with the profits, she will invest in more items that she currently does not stock. She also plans to replace her computers to give offer her customers good service.

loans.use: to buy more items such as perfumes, cell phones, and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of hair extensions, hair weaves and beauty products.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhjargal, 43 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been running a transportation business since 2008.

Before rendering a transportation service, he had been selling protein-powered noodles but due to intense competition, he stopped this business. His wife has been a saleswoman at her sister’s counter but recently began her own business which includes selling gloves, hats and scarves.

In order to increase the current assets of his wife’s business, he is requesting the loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy the above mentioned goods. By doing so, the family can generate more income, thus improving their living standard and invest in their children’s education without worry.

loans.use: to purchase gloves, hats and scarves

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells ladies' wear and children’s wear, which she has done for 4 years. She has 4 children and is married to a mason. She uses her to income to support her husband in paying their accommodation and utility bills. Abena needs this loan to purchase more ladies' wear and children’s wear for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Abena will acquire a shop for the sale of her clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' wear and children’s wear for sale

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia sells cassava, plantain and vegetables at Besease, near Elmina. She has done this for three years. Cynthia is married to a mason and has five dependents. Cynthia uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of their family. She will use her loan to purchase more cassava, plantain and vegetables for sale. Cynthia will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, plantain and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Merah 2 Group

texts.en:
Dede is the leader of Merah 2 Group, a group of four people. They live in Tanah Rendah in the east of Jakarta. 

Dede is 35 years old and married to Slamet. The couple is blessed with two children, Lalita (10 years old) and Dwi (7 years old).  

Dede and Slamet work together to run a business. Dede and Slamet live together with their children and take care of the different household responsibilities together.  

Dede has a kiosk in a market near her house in which she has sold stationary and construction tools for more than ten years. This business allows her to pay her children's school fees and to meet her daily needs. Competitors are her challenge to this business. 

Dede and the other members of the Merah 2 Group are requesting financial support from VisionFund Indonesia for the second time, so they can increase their working capital. Dede will use her portion of the loan to buy pencils, notebooks, screws, and screwdrivers to add to her merchandise.  She has a dream to send her children to the university.

loans.use: to buy stationary and construction tools for her business.

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, Ogbedei and Odoley, who both sell fish in the community. 

Ogbedei is a 30-year-old fish seller who is married to Adjei, a thirty-seven-year-old mason, and they both have three children. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and she seems to be doing very good. She has been in this business activity for 12 years now. She hawks from Mondays to Saturdays. Some of the fish is displayed in the photograph. 

This is her 6th loan and the needed loan amount of 850 GHS is to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been able, through her business and with the help of her husband, to provide their children with quality education. She gives the praise of her success to when she joined ID Ghana. 

They need a total amount of 1,450 GHS to buy more fish to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Trevenia

texts.en: Trevenia, 33, is married and lives in the Paynesville South community. She is a mother of three children between the ages of 4 and 19. All of her children are attending school. Her husband is a business man. For the past nine years she has been operating a provision shop, where she sells beans, vita, bath soap, hair grease, biscuits, sardines, lunch meat, bread, soft drinks, and many other items. Trevenia learned to sell from her mother. Her shop is open from 6 am to 10 pm. She makes a profit when she sells, because she has what her customers need and she is always at their service. With the profit generated from the business, she buys more goods to sell. She buys from wholesale dealers and transports her goods by commercial vehicle. She is requesting this loan to purchase more bath soap, biscuits, soft drinks, sardines, beans, and hair grease for the business. Her plan for the future is to give her children a good education and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bath soap, biscuits, soft drinks, sardines, beans, and hair grease for her shop

loans.name: Cheick Oumar

texts.fr:
Âgé de plus 26 ans, Monsieur Cheick Oumar est célibataire et résidant chez son père dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Cheick Oumar n’a pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, il s’est très vite initié depuis plus de dix années à la vente des pièces détachée auto  auprès de son frère à Sikasso. Sa boutique se située au nouveau marché de médine Sikasso et la plupart de sa clientèle est composée d’hommes surtout les forains. Avec une telle expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une parfaite confiance de sa clientèle. Il achète des marchandises à Lomé (république de Togo) et  afin de les revendre aux garagiste et particuliers de Sikasso. Dans les souci de mieux satisfaire des commandes de plus en plus croissantes, il sollicite ainsi ce premier crédit auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Ce premier crédit lui permettra d’acheter 10 paires enjoliver, 5 paires de coussin et 20 jantes.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 F CFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son magasin.
texts.en:
More than 26 years old, Mister Cheick Oumar is single and lives with his father in a large traditional family in Hamdallaye, one of the popular neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

Mister Cheick Oumar didn't have the chance to progress in school, he very quickly learned the sale of automobile spare parts from his brother in Sikasso more than ten years ago. His shop is located at the new market of Médine Sikasso and most of his clientèle consists of men especially foreigners. With such experience in this domain, he enjoys perfect confidence from his clientèle. He buys his merchandise in Lomé (republic of Togo) and then resells it to the garage owners and individuals of Sikasso. Concerned about better satisfying the orders which are growing more and more, he is thus requesting this first loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

This first loan will allow him to buy 10 pairs of hubcaps, 5 pairs of cushions and 20 wheel rims.

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA. With the profits made, he plans to settle his essential personal expenses, contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on his loan and invest the rest in his shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Lazar

texts.en:
Lazar is a single male who lives in a minority community in a southern part of Kosovo. He is planning to start his own business in agriculture. Lazar has had a lot of experience working on his land for many years.
He is planning to buy tractor and other tools to start his business working on the land of others. In this way, according to him, he can earn a lot of income. In his village there is a very big demand for people to work on the land with a tractor and they always pay for this service. Now Lazar is requesting a loan in order to buy a tractor. The loan will help him to start his business, which will allow him to earn an income for living expenses. He hopes in the future to expand his business to buy more tractors and to hire employees to work for him. His goal is to save money for his future and to get married. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders who are helping him to start his business!

loans.use: to buy a tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair relaxers to sell.

loans.name: German Nicolas

texts.es:
GERMAN NICOLAS tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

GERMAN NICOLAS se dedica a la agricultura a las siembras de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata monte, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito estará dispuesto a trabajar y cambiar el estilo de vida.

El sueño es hacerce una casa con jardín. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades, plagas en el cultivo.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar los cultivos.
texts.en:
German Nicolas is 21 years old and single with no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, Provincia de los Rios [Province of the Rivers]. 

He is a member of VRC LA VICTORIA, located in the Pantano district and part of the canton Ventanas which is dedicated to agricultural and livestock activities.

German Nicolas makes a living in agriculture growing rice and corn. He makes purchases in the city of Ventanas. He requests the loan to buy insecticides, urea, Mata Monte liquid [an herbicide], and fertilizers. With the help of the loan he will be able to work and change his style of life. 

His dream is to build himself a house with a garden. The challenges which he faces are crop diseases and plagues. 

In his free time, he likes to take care of his farm.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea, herbicide, and fertilizers

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 33-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Masindi ,Uganda. For six years, she has been selling clothes. With the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house. Price fluctuations and ever-changing customer preferences hinder her business. Her dream is to own a boutique. Her personal goal is to educate her children up to the university. Jackline is requesting for a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julia Maritza

texts.es:
Doña  Julia, tiene 56 años de edad, originaria de Managua, tiene 3 hijos el cual unas de ella esta cursando  su carrera universitaria de administración de empresas, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Inicio hace 10 años vendiendo ropa usada, pues su deseo de superación le ayudo a seguir adelante  vendiendo otros productos adicionales como fresco, frijoles, etc. Hoy en día cuenta con 10 años de  tener su venta de ropa fija, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su hija, sus expectativas es diversificarse en productos para su negocio.
Julia solicita el crédito para comprar  ropa usada como pantalones, faldas, blusas, etc. Todos los productos  mas solicitados por sus  clientes, ella estima que le ayudaría a incrementar sus ventas, mejorando a su vez las ganancias, sus planes futuros es iniciar una pulpería para que le genere mejores  ingresos, ya que es algo que le va ayudar a salir adelante con su familia, sus metas próximas es invertir mas en su negocio comprando mas ropa para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is 56 years old, originally from Managua, and has three children, one of whom is completing a university degree in business administration. She is in the commercial trade, and makes a living through the sale of used clothing. She began selling used clothing 10 years ago. Her desire to excel helped her to go forward selling other products such as soft drinks, beans, etc.

Today she counts 10 years of having her used clothing business. In her business she receives the support of her daughter. Her hope is to diversify the products for her business. 

Julia requests the loan to buy used clothing such as pants, skirts, blouses, etc., all products that are most requested by her customers. She thinks that these products will help her increase her sales, at the same time improving her earnings. 

Her future plan is to start a juice stand in order to generate more income, since it is something that will help her family get ahead. Her next goals are to invest more in her business, buying more clothes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothes such as pants, skirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance sells second-hand ladies' and children's dresses. She has been in this business for some years now. Constance is married with six children.   She uses her income to support her husband pay utility and accommodation bills. Constance needs this loan to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit, Constance plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Shpetim

texts.en:
Shpetim is 25 years old, engaged to be married and lives in the Northern part of Kosovo. Shpetim is a musician who performs at weddings and other family celebrations. He and his brother have been involved in this business for more than three years. He considers his business to be very profitable. He is very busy during the summertime when lots of Kosvars celebrate weddings and require entertainment for other types of celebrations. 
He works a lot during that time in order to save money for the winter when business is much slower. Shpetim is now requesting a loan to buy a sound system, which he will use for his performances. The loan will help him to have better equipment so that he can earn more income.
He hopes in the future to buy new musical instruments, which will allow him to improve the quality of his music. His goal is to save money for his future and to get married. 
He thanks all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy a sound system for his performances.

loans.name: Rober

texts.es:
Con 26 años de edad Rober es un joven muy emprendedor y de muchos objetivos a largo plazo. Tiene por pareja a Corina de 23 años quien es su compañera de vida y desea formar un lindo hogar ya que por el momento no tienen hijos, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo en conjunto a logrado culminar el primer piso de una vivienda  a base de material noble. Como parte de una herencia inmaterial por parte de sus padres logró aprender desde muy niño las diversas actividades del mundo agrícola, especialmente en la producción de cacao orgánico. Posteriormente opto por independizarse logrando adquirir unas parcelas desde hace 11 años en donde hasta hoy con el apoyo de Corina ha logrado convertirlo en el principal sustento económico de su familia.
Para lograr obtener buenas ganancias gracias a este gran producto debe dedicarse de lleno a las tareas de producción el cual parte desde el deshierbo de maleza, fermentado y secado, siendo uno de los mas importantes el deshierbo para evitar así la competencia entre mala hierba y nutrientes que poseen los suelos, adicional a ello es necesario realizar una pequeña evaluación de los suelos en general para seleccionar el tipo de abono orgánico a emplearse, siendo el guano de isla uno de los mejores y mas acoplables a los diversos tipos de suelos en la región.
Por tratarse de un área considerable desea por inicio de campaña contar con la mano de obra por parte de los jornaleros del lugar quienes posteriormente emplearán el abono orgánico para así garantizar una producción de calidad. 
Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan en reunir capital suficiente  y tener un futuro con muchas oportunidades para sus futuros hijos, espera con esa motivación seguir adelante y trabajar con el mismo empuje que lo caracteriza. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles que solicita, realizará un mantenimiento consistente  el deshierbo con apoyo de jornaleros del lugar , así como la compra de sacos con guano de ave como abono orgánico para garantizar una producción de calidad.
texts.en:
At 26 Rober is an enterprising young man with long-term goals. His life partner Corina is 23, and he wants to start a home, though he does not have children now. Thanks to their hard work, they have completed the first floor of their house with good materials. As a child, his parents taught him how to farm and, in particular, to grow organic cacao. Later, he decided to farm on his own, and 11 years ago he acquired land that he now works with Corina and is the main source of their income. 

To increase their earnings, they have focused on producing cacao: removing weeds and fermenting and drying it. Weed removal is the most important task, since it is critical to keep the weeds from absorbing the nutrients in the soil. Evaluating the soil to determine the best organic fertilizer to use is necessary, and island bird guano is one of the best suited to the regional soils. Since Rober has a large area to cultivate, he wants to hire day laborers, and he will also spread organic fertilizer to ensure a quality crop. 

In order to meet his goals and provide a brighter future for his children, Rober needs working capital. With this motivation, he expects to get ahead and continue to work hard. The 1,500 nuevos soles he has requested will be used to removed weeds with the help of the day workers and to buy sacks of organic bird fertilizer to ensure a quality crop.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and to buy sacks of organic bird fertilizer.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells cassava, plantain and vegetables at Besease near Elmina. She has done this for 5 years now. Efua is married to a mason and has 5 dependents. Efua uses her income to assists her husband in the upkeep of their family.

She will use her loan to purchase more cassava, plantain and vegetables for sale. Efua will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, plantain and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bash Group

texts.en:
The group consists of two partners, namely Georgina and Margaret, both residing at Teshie.  They have been a group for two years now and are doing very well. 

Georgina is a 37-year-old trader who deals in jewelry, gari (fried cassava paste) and pure water. This has been her work for the past 8 years and she still is doing very well. With the gari (fried cassava paste), she goes to Ada (Greater Accra Region) for it, while she travels to Benin for the jewelry. Because of her integrity and frankness, all her customers have her at heart. 

She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and still loves to be part of us for all her life. She has taken 5 loans and has fully repaid all.  On her 6th loan, she needs 1,900 GHS to help her meet her customers' demand.
