A Blanca siempre le ha gustado el comercio anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de condimentos de forma ambulante y hace dos años decidió establecer su pulpería en la casa para estar mas con sus hijos y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, ella vende granos básicos, azúcar, pan, churros, refrescos, dulces, pastillas, manteca, sal, café y otros productos para aseo. Ella ha tenido varios préstamos con ODEF y ha visto que su negocio está creciendo. este préstamo actual es por 8,000 lempiras y lo utilizara para seguir surtiendo su negocio de productos alimenticios, como arroz, azúcar, manteca, pan, churros, café, sal, refrescos y otros, con el fin de incrementar el inventario y sus ventas. Su plan es que el negocio le genere ingresos para que sus hijos alcancen un nivel educativo alto, y mejorar su casa para tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blanca, 41, is a single mother of five children; she lives in Quimistan, Santa Bárbara.  Blanca has always enjoyed commerce; she used to work selling condiments from place to place and two years ago decided to open a grocery store at home in order to spend more time with her children and have her own source of income.  She sells basic grains, sugar, bread, packaged snacks, soft-drinks, candy, pills, lard, salt, coffee and other cleaning supplies.  She has had several ODEF loans and has seen her business grow.  This current loan is for 8,000 Lempiras and she’ll use it to continue stocking her store with food items like rice, sugar, lard, bread, snacks, coffee, salt, soft-drinks and others aiming at increasing inventory and stale.  Her plan is that the business generates income sufficient for her children to attain a high educational level and to make home improvements to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth de 53 años de edad tiene una papelería en un punto de su propia casa, ubicada en el municipio de Soledad, donde habita con su familia. Muy pronto llega la navidad y el año nuevo y ella debe tenerla surtida con todo lo que la época requiere para poder incrementar sus ventas, tal como ocurre todos los años.Como conoce muy bien su negocio y los picos de venta de cada temporada ella mantiene su negocio surtido en cada época, desde el año 2008, cuando inició su emprendimiento comercial con una miscelánea; ella  anteriormente tenia una peluquería, donde ofrecía servicios de estética y de mejoramiento personal de la imagen de sus clientes, y posteriormente observando el mercado poco a poco creo la papelería, con la cual hoy satisface las necesidades de su barrio y de otros sectores aledaños. En la actualidad su negocio necesita ser surtido mucho más y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograrlo, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado, chancleta y papelería. Su meta principal es hacer crecer su negocio y por eso se esmera trabajando desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, de lunes a domingo con el fin de lograr su sueño de prosperidad familia.
texts.en: 53-year-old Janeth runs a stationery store in her own house, which is located in the town of Soledad where she lives with her family. Christmas and the New Year are very fast approaching and she needs to stock up her store with everything that is needed during this season, so that she can increase her sales as she does every year. Since she knows her business and each season's highest selling time very well, she keeps it well-stocked during each season. She has been doing this since 2008, when she first went into business with a general store. She used to own a hair salon where she provided her customers with beauty and personal image enhancement services. Later on, she gradually observed the market trends and opened the stationery store, which currently meets the demands from her neighborhood and other neighboring areas. She currently needs to stock up her business much more and her working capital is not enough to achieve that. That's the reason why she's requesting a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She'll use it to purchase footwear, flip-flops and stationery items. Her main goal is to expand her business. For that reason she works hard from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m., Monday through Sunday, in order to accomplish her dream of seeing her family prosper.

loans.use: to purchase footwear, flip-flops and stationery items.

loans.name: Maryluz

texts.es: Maryluz, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de San Luis, Comayagua. Ella es muy emprendedora, mientras estudiaba elaboraba pan para vender y costearse sus estudios. Actualmente administra el negocio de una pulpería que heredo de sus padres, esta pulpería tiene 14 años de existencia, y tiene buena clientela. Maryluz quiere que este negocio se mantenga y crezca más y que le genere los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a sus padres y tener calidad de vida. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado por 21,000 Lempiras surtirá el negocio de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, azúcar, huevos, dulces, pan, manteca, harina, productos de aseo, condimentos y otros abarrotes. Con esta inversión va aumentar su clientela y sus ingresos. De las ganancias ella quiere ahorrar  y reinvertir en su negocio para hacerlo crecer.
texts.en: Maryluz, 24, is single living with her parents in a village that belongs to the municipality of San Luis, Comayagua.  She’s very enterprising.  While she was studying she’d bake bread to sell to pay for her schooling.  She currently manages a grocery store she inherited from her parents.  The store has been in operation for 14 years and has a good clientele.  Maryluz wants the business to continue and to grow more so that it will generate the income necessary to help her parents and to have a good quality of life.  With the 21,000 Lempira loan she’s requested, she will stock up on food items like basic grains, sugar, eggs, candy, bread, lard, flour, condiments and other food items as well as with cleaning supplies.  With this investment she will increase her clientele and her income.  She wants to save her profits to reinvest in the business and make it grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Shikana Group

texts.fr:
Dorothée fait partie du groupe  Shikana  et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 60 ans. 
 Elle a 2 enfants le cadet a 37 ans et l’aîné a 40 ans.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 orphelins dont l'un étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de pagnes  depuis  30 ans. 

Elle est à son treizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup  de pagnes (15 pagnes de plus)  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle et  voir l’enfant sous sa charge, terminer les études.
texts.en:
Dorothée is a member of the Shikana group and lives in Bujumbura. She is a 60 year old widow, with two children - the younger is 37 and the elder 40 years old. She also looks after two orphans -one of whom is studying. She has been trading in traditional 'pagnes' dresses for thirty years. This will be her thirteenth loan with Turame.
With this loan from Kiva, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity (fifteen more) 'pagnes', to resell in order to increase her profits. In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land and to see the child she is raising complete his studies.

loans.use: increase her working capital and purchase fifteen traditional robes for resale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia es una mujer de 38 años, que se especializa en la venta de bisutería en acero y plata, desde hace 14 años, su experiencia data, desde en el año 1998, cuando empezó a trabajar en un almacén de bisutería, lugar donde estuvo durante 4 años, en los cuales también vendía a clientes particulares, lo que en el futuro le permitió independizarse, cuando dejó de ser empleada de esa empresa. Hoy Olivia trabaja haciendo su preventa diaria y conoce muy bien cuál es la mejor época del año para invertir: Mayo, Septiembre y Diciembre y es allí donde tener capital de trabajo para hacerlo en volumen y ganar buenos descuentos se convierte en un desafío, pues no alcanza a recoger el dinero necesario para realizar sus compras: Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  aretes, cadenas, anillos, pulseras y tobilleras. Con el préstamo, ella aprovechará la temporada alta de fin de año, para impactar a su clientela que ha hecho sus pedidos y ganar nuevos compradores, aumentando así su capital de trabajo y asegurando nuevos ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares. Sus clientes son principalmente vendedores de almacenes, y ella les hace visita permanente en los  almacenes ubicados en centros comerciales, para exhibir sus productos y lograr éxito en sus ventas, de allí que su actitud en el mercado derive el potencial de éxito de su credikiva. Su próxima meta es  formalizar su negocio obteniendo el registro mercantil, y en un futuro  tener su propio local, y siempre trabajar el la ampliación de su clientela
texts.en:
Olivia, 38, sells imitation jewelry in steel and silver since 1998, when she started working in an imitation jewelry store. She worked there for four years but was at the same time selling on her own, which made it possible for her to become independent when she left the company.

Today, Olivia works by pre-selling every day and she knows very well which are the best seasons for investing: May, September and December. These months are when she has the challenge of gathering the money in order to buy in bulk and take advantage of the good discounts, but she does not manage to gather enough. This is why she is requesting a credikiva, the first loan she requests at Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will buy earrings, chains, rings, and wrist and ankle bracelets.

With the loan, she will make the most of the upcoming high season by impressing the customers she already has and attracting new ones. This will increase her working capital and will assure new income to pay for her home expenses.

Her customers are mainly shop owners, and she frequently visits them in their shops, which are located in shopping malls, in order to display her products and increase her sales. Her attitude gives a sign of the potential success she will have with her credikiva. Her next goal is to formalize her business and get the fiscal identity number. In the future, she wants to have her own establishment and continue to work in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy earrings, chains, rings and bracelets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah, age 33, runs a small retail business selling such items as slippers, body cream, spray, and powder. She learned the business from friends already engaged in it, and she has been managing this venture for the past 12 years. She received an education through the fourth grade. She lives with her husband and their three children in Buchanan Ground Bassa County. Their children are between the ages of 10 and 19 years old.

Siah is requesting a loan in order to purchase more items such as slippers, body cream, spray, and powder to offer for sale. She tells us that she likes her business because it helps her to sustain her family. Her plans are to build her house and expand her business. She also wants to encourage her friends to join the business world.

loans.use: purchase items such as slippers, body cream, spray, and powder to offer for sale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has four children and has been farming for six years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry keeping!" Her biggest challenge is the high cost of feed.

Susan was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Because of my poultry project."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "Farming as a business."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Susan replied, "Improved quality of life."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Susan owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a bicycle; she does not own a pig, a pump, a motorcycle or an automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Deybis

texts.es: Deybis  tiene  23 años de edad, esta casado y vive con la esposa y una hija actualmente. El  con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Deybis is 23, is married and lives with his wife and daughter.  With the loan he plans to buy fertilizer, pesticide and get some help through labor.  He plans to maintain his plantation so that they don't suffer any damages or lose production; this way with his coffee plantation project he will be able to obtain more profits to contribute to his family, he doesn't have the necessary working capital for the purchases, because he has low resources and doesn't have a way to obtain the money necessary to do it, reason why he requested a loan and this is the first loan that he will get from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had previous loan with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with more facilities and a low interest rate…

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
JUAN FRANCISCO tiene 24 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, vive con la conyugue y la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

JUAN FRANCISCO se dedica a la agricultura a las siembras de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata monte, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podra cambiar el estilo de vida de la familia.

El sueño es comprar terreno y sembras más. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades, plagas en el cultivo.
En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar los cultivos y cosechar.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco is 24 and lives in common law, he has an eight-year-old daughter, lives with his partner and daughter in the city of Ventanas Province of Los Rios.

He is a member of the VRC La Victoria, it's located in the Recinto Pantano, belongs to the Canton Ventanas where they work in Agriculture and Livestock.

Juan Francisco works in agriculture growing corn and rice.  He buys his inputs in the city of Ventanas.  He requests the loan to buy insecticide, urea, pesticide and fertilizers.  With the help from the loan he will be able to change the lifestyle of his family.

His dream is to buy a piece of land and grow more crops.  The challenges that he faces are diseases and plagues in the crops.

During his free time he enjoys taking care of his crop and harvesting.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, pesticide and fertilizers.

loans.name: Danny Alfredo

texts.es:
Danny Alfredo tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el papá en ventanas provincia de los Ríos. 


Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Danny Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, ranger y fertilizantes.Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios y aumentar la produccion.  Las compras lo hace en Ventanas cada mes.

El sueño es poder comprar una casa y un terreno para seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta  practicar el  indor.
texts.en:
Danny Alfredo is 32 years old, single and has no children, he lives with his father in Ventanas province of Los Rios.

He is a member of the community bank El Recreo, which is located in San Vicente las lomas, belongs to the Canton Ventanas, this group works in livestock and agriculture.

Danny Alfredo works in agriculture growing corn.  He requests the loan to buy seed, insecticide, urea, ranger and fertilizers.  With the help from the loan he will be able to buy the fertilizers needed and increase production.  He makes his purchases at Ventanas once a month.

His dream is to be able to buy a house and a piece of land to continue growing crops.  During his free time he likes to practice street soccer.

loans.use: to buy seed, insecticide, urea, ranger and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.es: María, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hija menor en una aldea del municipio de La Masica, Atlántida. Desde hace 6 años María se dedica al comercio a vender productos cosméticos y otros de Catálogos de productos AVON y ´Marlen Lamur. Vende cremas, champú, tratamientos para la piel y cabello, lociones, desodorantes, tintes y otros productos que le pidan sus clientes. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante mediante catalogo y por pedidos. Doña María decidió solicitar este préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar productos como cremas, desodorantes, lociones, tratamientos, tintes, maquillajes y otros. En esta temporada ella tiene más pedidos de sus clientes y necesita cumplirles. Su meta principal es seguir trabajando para ver a su hija profesional.
texts.en: María, 54, is a single mother living with her youngest daughter in a village in the municipality of Masica, Atlántida.  For the last six years María has been selling cosmetics and other products from Avon and Marlen Lamur catalogues.  She sells creams, shampoo, hair and skin treatments, lotions, deodorants, hair color and other products her customers request.  The sales are done from place to place via catalogue and on order.  María decided to take out this 15,000 Lempira loan to buy products like creams, deodorants, lotions, treatments, hair color, make-up and others.  She has more customer orders this season and she needs to fill them.  Her main goal is to continue working to see her daughter become a professional.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Clelia Alba Luz

texts.es:
La Señora Clelia tiene 35 años de edad,  es casada, tiene 1 hijos reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Departamento de Cortés.
Clelia se dedica a la venta de alimentos de la canasta básica desde hace 4 años a través de una pulpería.
Su esposo se dedica a la producción agrícola y ella atiende a sus clientes en el negocio.
Con el propósito de surtir su  pulpería ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 25,000 Lempiras los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de granos básicos, productos de limpieza, cereales, medicamentos de uso común, golosinas, refrescos, condimentos y pan.
Ella espera aumentar su clientela al ofrecer variedad de productos, así como sus utilidades que le servirán para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Clelia, 35, is married and has one child; she lives with her family in a community in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortés Department.  Clelia has been selling basic staples in a grocery store for four years.  Her husband works in agriculture and she tends to her customers in the store.  

With the goal of stocking her store, she’s asking for a 25,000 Lempira loan to buy basic grains, cleaning supplies, cereals, common medicines, snacks, soft-drinks, condiments and bread.  She hopes to increase her clientele and to offer a variety of goods and hopes to use her profits to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Enilda Del Carmen

texts.es: Enilda con su credikiva compró mucha mercancía que sin este recurso no hubiera logrado hacerlo. Como en cada temporada se prepara para recibirla con productos apropiados a la época, ella está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará productos para hacer pasteles y derivados de la harina de trigo, además de ropa, calzado entre otros. Ella envía un mensaje especial a sus financiadores“Muchos agradecimientos por este apoyo tan benéfico y determinante para mi vida y la mi única hija con quien sueño en ver convertido en una profesional muy exitosa. “
texts.en:
Enilda used her Kiva loan to buy much merchandise that she wouldn’t have been able to do so without this resource.  Since she gets ready to receive each season with appropriate goods, she’s applying for a new Kiva loan to buy ingredients to bake cakes and other baked goods derived from wheat.  She will also buy clothes and shoes, among others. 

She sends a very special message to her lenders:  “Very grateful for this support that’s so beneficial and decisive for my live and for my only daughter who I dream with seeing become a very successful professional.”

loans.use: to buy baking supplies, clothes and shoes, among others.

loans.name: Rita Virginia

texts.es:
La Señora Rita tiene 50 años de edad,  es casada, tiene 2 hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del municipio de San Francisco, Departamento de Atlántida.
Rita se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante,  con la idea de tener un negocio más estable, decidió desde hace un año dedicarse a la venta de alimentos por medio de una pulpería ubicada en su casa.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de arroz, fríjoles, manteca, harina, azúcar, frescos, lácteos, carnes y productos de limpieza.
Doña Rita espera aumentar su capital de trabajo y  obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan siempre seguir adelante.
texts.en: Rita, 50, is married and has two children; she lives with her family in a community in the municipality of San Francisco, Atlántida Department.  She used to work selling cosmetics from place to place but with the idea of having a more stable business a year ago she decided to start selling food in a home-based grocery store.  She’s currently asking for a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy rice, beans, lard, flour, sugar, soft-drinks, dairy products, meat and cleaning supplies.  Rita hopes to increase working capital and earn higher profits that will make it possible for her to continue forward always.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Beatriz De La Asunción

texts.es: Beatriz tiene una miscelánea donde ofrece gran variedad de productos desde hace 16 años, la diversidad de su oferta ha logrado su sostenibilidad y ella en cada época está dispuesta a invertirle todo lo relacionado con las exigencias de ella. Así es como a final de año las navidades y el año nuevo son los motivos principales de sus ventas y por eso necesita capital de trabajo, para lograr tener todo lo que su clientela necesita sin excepción, pues sus precios son justos y el reconocimiento de su miscelánea en el barrio    es notorio, hasta la esperan si ella se ausenta por hacer sus compras u otros trámites que su negocio requiere. Sus ventas las hace de contado y algunas a crédito; ella está muy feliz en su negocio, porque dice no rendirle cuentas a nadie, es decir le gusta su autonomía y con ella ha desarrollado su capacidad de trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa variada y calzado que le sirvan hasta que llegue otra temporada comercial, como el día de las madres, donde también pueda ofrecerlas. Su credikiva será muy exitoso por la época de gran movimiento comercial en la cual será invertido, porque todos sus clientes tendrán la respuesta a sus necesidades, deseos e intereses, en su miscelánea.
texts.en:
Beatriz has a variety store where she’s been selling a wide selection of goods for 16 years.  Her inventory’s diversity has led to her sustainability and every season she’s willing to invest everything necessary to meet her needs.  This is how at the end of the year Christmas and New Years are the main reasons for her sales and this is why she needs working capital to have everything her customers need without exception because her prices are fair and her variety store is very well-known in her neighborhood; they even wait for her f she’s away shopping or doing other chores her business requires.  She sells for cash and some on credit.  She’s very happy in her business because she says she needs answer to no one, that is, she likes the autonomy with which she’s developed her capacity to work.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy assorted clothing and shoes that will do until the next season, like Mother’s Day, arrives and she can also sell them then.  Her Kiva loan will be very successful because of the busy commercial season in which it will be invested because all her customers will have their needs, wishes and interests met in her variety store.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Beatriz de la Asunción from Colombia

loans.use: to buy assorted clothes and shoes.

loans.name: 13 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El comité “13 de Junio” nace gracias a la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en esa zona. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  ellas fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Silvia es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, se dedica a la peluquería y también es empleada doméstica.  Trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Silvia cuenta que le está yendo muy bien en su trabajo de peluquera se ha hecho de buena clientela y se está haciendo conocida por sus buenos trabajos.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de insumos de peluquería, ya que quiere seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que su grupo recibe, pues es muy importante para ellas.
texts.en:
The "13 de Junio" communal bank first began thanks to the management and the support of another communal bank that operated in that area. This group comes from the town of San Lorenzo and they have set the growth of each one of them as their main goal. They are known in the area as very hard-working women.
Silvia is a very hard-working and enterprising person. She works as a hairdresser and also as a maid. She works every day from the very early hours of the morning. Silvia reports that her hairdressing business is going very well. She has gotten a good number of customers and she's becoming well-known for her good work.
She requests this loan in order to purchase hairdressing supplies, since she wishes to keep on providing her customers with quality service. She gives thanks for the help that her communal bank has received, because that's very important to them.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing supplies.

loans.name: Jadira Belixe

texts.es:
JADIRA BELIXE tiene 38 años de edad es madre soltera tiene una hija de 14 años de edad, vive unicamente con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

JADIRA BELIXE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maìz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes. Las compras las realizarà en la ciudad de Ventanas.
 Los desafios a los que  se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. El sueño es comprarce una moto. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli y jugar indor.
texts.en:
Jadira Belixe, 38, is a single mother with a 14-year-old daughter.  She lives only with her daughter in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  She's a member of La Victoria Communal Bank in the Pantano district of Ventanas Canton, where people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Jadira Belixe makes a living growing corn and rice.  She's requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea, and liquid weedkiller.  The loan will help her be able to buy the fertilizer.  She'll make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

The challenges she faces are crop pests and diseases.  Her dream is to buy herself a motorcycle.  In her free time she likes to play volleyball and indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, and weedkiller

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino lives in Sachkhere District. She is 57 years old and lives with her grown son, daughter-in-law, and a grandchild. The source of income for the family is an agricultural business -- a small dairy farm with a milk cow whose milk is used in cheese products. Some of the produced cheese is sold at the local open market, and the rest is left for the family's consumption. 

The total average monthly income is 100 GEL, which is hardly enough for food for a four-member family. Tsitsino and her son decided to start their business as their existing income wasn't enough for the family, and their living conditions are poor. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with easy conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the received credit, Tsitsino will purchase a car, and her son will serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her son to use as a taxi

loans.name: Petre

texts.en: Petre is 62 years old. He lives with his wife in Samtredia district, West Georgia. His wife is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. Specifically, they have a milk cow and 2 calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Besides that, they have 2 pigs and sell piglets locally. Petre is involved in a poultry raising business. He sells chickens locally. Petre is a very hardworking man and has a wealth of experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing feed for the poultry. After buying the feed, he will fatten his poultry properly and sell the birds at a good price. This will significantly increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Petre awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel is 32 years old and the head of her household.  She lives with her two children in a ger in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Her daughter Ariunzaya, age 10, goes to a local primary school and her son Monhbayar, age 4, goes to a local kindergarten. 

Altangerel has been selling organic fruit and vegetables since 2000. She has been operating various kinds of businesses because she is the only one working for her family. Altangerel is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase meat and livestock to sell in the local market because the fruit and vegetable business is seasonal and sales have decreased during the winter time. She is hardworking, responsible, and a communicative woman.

loans.use: to purchase meat and livestock to sell in the local market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Yanaway

texts.en:
Yanway is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan in the Ground Bassa County that is known for producing fish on the Liberian local market.  She is married and did not attend school.  She has six children between the ages of 12 and 32, four of whom are living on their own while the two young ones live at home and attend school.

For the past fifteen years she has been selling dishes (cups, plates, bowls, etc.), handbags, trousers and other items in the local market.  She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more dishes (cups, plates, bowls, etc.), handbags, trousers and other items for her business.  She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dishes, handbags, trousers and other items for her business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha, 25, lives in the Paynesville South community with her friend and her lovely two-year-old daughter. Very hardworking and focused on her business, Oretha has been selling raw bonnie and cassava fish for the past five years, working six days a week from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.; her friend, who is a contractor, helps her out in this business.

Grateful to all the lenders who are contributing towards her enterprise, Oretha is requesting this loan to purchase more cartons of fish to sell. Her dream is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of fish for the business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. She has four children and has been working in agriculture for 10 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. She says what is most enjoyable about farming is: "Poultry keeping!" Her biggest challenge is the "high cost of feeds." The animals in the farm are not named.

Lilian was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Fair interest rates."  She was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and she said: "Record keeping."

Lilian's highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Lilian replied "I will be able to pay fees for my children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lilian owns the following: "cow, poultry, bicycle" but does not own "pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and a TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and to send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene una pequeña  fábrica de helados y paletas. Vive en Barranquilla,   ciudad en la costa caribeña de Colombia, donde hace calor todo el año, por lo cual sus productos siempre están en demanda. Él laboró en una fábrica de helados por más de 10 años, y en el año 2004 decidió salirse del trabajo e iniciar su propio e independiente negocio; a él todo le ha salido en estos  últimos 8 años, por eso entusiasmado, cada día empieza a trabajar desde las 6 de la mañana, comprando sus insumos en grande superficies comerciales   y también en pequeños mercados locales.  Por el momento, Jorge vende directamente al consumidor final, pero su meta para su negocio es aumentar la producción y   lograr vender a los supermercados,  consolidandose en ellos como sus máximos clientes. Para él, ha sido dificil hacer la publicidad de su negocio, pero espera q poder ampliar su producción y ganar más clientes, aplicando a créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que ha ce a esta organización, mediante el cual comprará  insumos en mayor volumen como leche entera liquida, azucar, sabores naturales y mantequilla. Con esté préstamo, él va a empezar el ascenso en su producción y tambien incremntará sus ingresos, pues cuenta con mas capital de trabajo para sus compras y capacidad personal de trabajo para producir.Jorge es padre a dos hijas de 15 y 19 años y quiere proveer para ellas y su cónyugue todo lo que esté a su alcance y las haga en el presente y futuro muy felices..
texts.en:
Jorge has a small ice-cream and frozen pops factory.  He lives in Barranquilla, a city on the Colombian Caribbean coast where it’s hot year-round which is why his products are always in demand.  He worked in a frozen treat factory for more than 10 years and in 2004 decided to leave that job to start his own business.  

Everything has turned out well for him these last 8 years so he’s very excited and starts work every day at 6am buying ingredients at large commercial establishments and also in small local markets.  For the moment, Jorge sells directly to the final consumer but his business goal is to increase production and sell to supermarkets becoming one of their major suppliers.  For him, publicizing his business has been difficult but he hopes that by applying for Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loans he will be able to expand production and win over more customers.  This is why he’s now applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with this institution that he will use to buy larger amounts of ingredients like whole, liquid milk, sugar, natural flavoring agents and butter.  

With this loan, he will start to increase production and will also increase his income because he’ll have more working capital for his purchases and personal capacity for work and to produce.  Jorge is the father of two daughters aged 15 and 19 and he wants to give them and his wife everything in his reach to make them very happy now and in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make frozen treats.

loans.name: Evunali

texts.en:
Evunali is a 32-year-old man and his primary source of income is the coffee trade. He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 GGX so as to mulch his coffee plantation. He has over five acres of coffee and will require over 2,000,000 UGX to mulch it, however he has only 500,000 UGX.

Evunali says that mulching his coffee plantation will help him control weeds and also retain some moisture during the dry season and thus increase his yield.

loans.use: to mulch his coffee shamba (field)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has three children and has been working in agriculture for 15 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. Esther says what is most enjoyable about farming is: "Poultry keeping!" Her biggest challenge is "poor pricing of farm products within the local markets."

Esther was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Because they deal with farmers and I am a farmer."  She was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and she said: "To develop a savings culture."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Esther replied "More income'"

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Esther owns the following: "cow, poultry," but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Boban

texts.en:
Boban is a single male. Boban’s parents have died and he lives with his brother in a minority community in the southern part of Kosovo. Based on family tradition, he works in the agricultural business. 

Boban is planning to start his own business -- plowing, maintaining, and working the land of others. He considers this business to be profitable and he is in need of a loan to buy a tractor. This loan will help him to realize his plans and to raise his income. 

He hopes in the future to continue his business. Boban’s goal is to get married and to have his own family. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy a tractor for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 34-year-old man who works in agriculture, primarily bananas.  He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX in order to complete his residential house. He intends to buy cement, sand, paint and bricks as well as to pay for the labor necessary to complete his residential house.  

Christopher has built the house in phases over the past five years and is determined to complete it this time.  He wants his family to live comfortably as they study so that they will have a bright future.  Since the festive season is coming up, he wants to be in a better environment.  His family will enjoy Christmas because they will be in a new house.

loans.use: to complete his house.

loans.name: Mavah

texts.en: Mavah 40, lives in Paynesville South. She stopped her education in the 12th grade. She is single and the mother of three children that are between the ages of 10 and 15. They stay with her at home, and are in school. Mavah has a cooking shop (restaurant) in her community, where she has been  preparing food for the past ten years. She sells six days a week. She prepares cassava leaves, potatoes, grains, palm butter, and okra to meet her customers' desires. She started this business with $5,000 Liberian dollars that she saved. She learned this type of trade from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for the business. She thanks lenders for empowering her in her business. Her plan for the future is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for the business

loans.name: Gletys

texts.es: Gletys de 23 años vive en Barranquilla, en la costa caribeña de Colombia, y tiene un almacén donde vende ropa y fantasia femenina. Ella vende productos como camisas, pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, cadenas, relojes y mucho más. Inicialmente vendia fantasia y ropa a sus compañeras de universidad hace 4 años a crédito y en un término corto sus clientes le pagaban; posteriormente compró una vitrina y se instaló en un lugar diferente a su lugar de residencia para vender estos productos directamente a sus clientes y agregó la venta de contado. Sus clientes incluyen amigos, familiares y vecinos,además de los referídos por estos mismos;    Gletys trabaja todos los días, comprando sus productos en grandes superficies de almacenes en el centro de la ciudad y lo distribuye y exhibe en su punto comercial entre su clientela. En cada temporada ella ha aprendido a exhibir lo que la época requiere y esto hace que su negocio tenga un potencial de éxito. En este año su clientela ha crecido y se acerca la época mas linda del año, en la cual todos celebran en familia las festividades y para ello necesitan lucir elegantes y para ello disponen de sus primas y bonificaciones para gastar; es justamente en este momento en donde su gran desafio es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr complacerlos a todos y obtener sus mejores ingresos  del año, pero para ello no es suficiente el dinero con el que cuneta y ha decidido acudir a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para invertir en más de estos productos como ropa, calzado, cosméticos, juguetes, papeleria navideña etc. Gletys es muy joven pero tiene grandes sueños. Ella quiere tener local propio y también   empleados en un futuro, para genera fuentes de empleo en quienes lo necesiten y contribuír con la sociedad de Barranquilla. Ella está casada y algún día quiere tener hijos y verlos crecer – pero por el momento, ella está enfocada en su negocio.
texts.en: Gletys, 23 years old, lives in Barranquilla on the Caribbean coast of Colombia. She has a store where she sells clothing and women's costume jewelry. She sells products such as shirts, pants, blouses, underwear, chains, watches, and much more. Initially she sold costume jewelry and clothing on credit to her university classmates of four years, and her customers paid her after a short time. Subsequently she bought a display case and set up shop in a location outside of her home in order to sell these products directly to her customers, and she added cash sales. Her customers include friends, family members, and neighbors, as well as referrals from these people. Gletys works every day, buying her products from large stores in the center of the city. She distributes them and displays them in her store among her customers. During each season she has learned to display what the time of year requires, and this gives her business the potential for success. This year her customer base has grown, and the most beautiful time of the year is coming, in which everyone celebrates the holidays with their families. They need to look elegant for that and they have their bonuses and refunds to spend. It is at just this moment that her great challenge is to have sufficient working capital to succeed in pleasing everyone and to obtain her best earnings of the year. The money she has is not sufficient for that, and she has decided to take out a Kiva loan. It is the first financing she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest in more of these products such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, toys, Christmas paper goods, etc. Gletys is very young, but she has big dreams. In the future, she wants to have her own building, and also employees in order to generate sources of employment for those who need it and to contribute to the society of Barranquilla. She is married and someday she wants to have children and watch them grow up - but for the moment, she is focused on her business.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, blouses, underwear, and more for her clothing store

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan in Ground Bassa County that is known for producing fish on the Liberian local market.  She is married and has four children between the ages of 14 and 22.  All of her children attend school.

For the past 10 years she has been selling rice, oil, Vita (a juice drink made by Coca Cola for the African market) and other items in the local market.  She started her business by obtaining some money from her husband.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase rice, oil, Vita and other items for her business.  She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, Vita and other items for her business.

loans.name: Mario Alfonso

texts.es: Para Mario los credikiva que ha recibido lo han ayudado mucho, pues ha incrementado sus inventarios, dando satisfacción a las necesidades de sus clientes y logrando así el incremento de sus ventas. Hoy su margen de ganancias es mayor, lo que le ha permitido poder arrendar toda la casa  y organizar mejor su negocio de una manera independiente de su hogar, dando una mejor atención a su clientela. Él dice a los financiadores de Kiva “Su apoyo es muy importante, y están ayudando a construir una mejor comunidad y con esto a alcanzar objetivos y metas propuestas. En la actualidad Mario Está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el que comprará mercancía ajustada a la época navideña y de año nuevo, papelería, accesorios, detalles para el hogar, como estrategia para impactar a sus clientes y captar su atención, interés, deseo y acción de compra, en esta temporada, donde los mejores deseos afloran y todos sus clientes, desean tener su hogar decorado a propósito de las fiestas y compartir obsequios, que muestren felicidad y amor en esta época.
texts.en:
The Kiva loans Mario has received have helped him a lot because he has increased his inventory, satisfying his customers' needs and increasing his sales.  His profit margin is greater today, which has allowed him to rent his house and better organize his business independently from his home, giving his customers better service.

To the Kiva lenders he says: "Your support is very important.  You're helping to build a better community and, with this, to achieve proposed objectives and goals."

Currently Mario's applying for another Kiva loan to buy merchandise for the Christmas and New Year season: stationery, accessories, and gifts for the home.  This is his strategy for attracting customers and getting their attention, interest, desire, and purchase this season, when the best desires surface and all his customers want to decorate their homes for parties and share gifts that show the happiness and love of this season.

loans.use: to buy stationery, accessories, and gifts for the home

loans.name: Batnairamdal

texts.en:
Batnairamdal is 23 years old and lives with his new wife and newborn baby daughter in a ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife Gegeentsetseg has just had their baby daughter Tsoglogmaa and stays home taking care of the baby. 

Batnairamdal has been running a taxi service business since 2010. His income has been barely meeting the family's expenses. Since they have a newborn baby in the family and his wife is not working, he decided to increase his income in order to meet at least the break-even point. Batnairamdal is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase billiard tables to start a billiards business in the area to increase his income. Batnairamdal is hardworking, responsible, and a kind person.

loans.use: to purchase billiard tables to start a billiards business in the area to increase his income

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Batmagnai, works for a private flour mill company. Her son, Baasanjav, age 7, goes to the local primary school and Temuun, age 3, goes to the local kindergarten. 

Altantsetseg has been running a business selling organic vegetables and fruits since 2008. She started her business as organic vegetable sales and has just expanded and started selling organic fruits, as well. 

She is now requesting a 1000000 MNT loan to purchase from agrarians in the area, a large amount of organic fruits and vegetables to resell during winter and spring. She is a hard-working, neat, and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase from agrarians in the area, a large amount of organic fruits and vegetables to resell during winter and spring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a heating system and change the windows into vacuum windows in order to reduce heat loss and stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winter

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Batsuh is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Uyanga, age 28, helps him to run his business of organic vegetable farming. His daughter Azzaya, age 6, goes to a local primary school and his younger daughter Buyan-Orshih, age 3, goes to kindergarten. 

Batsuh has been growing organic vegetables since 2003, and he also planted 50 blackberry trees on his land. He has just been chosen to supply his organic vegetables to a local primary school for lunches and he needs an additional investment of 1,200,000 MNT to cover transportation and other expenses regarding this order and he is also planning to reserve some seeds for next year's planting period. Batsuh is a diligent and welcoming person.

loans.use: to cover transportation and other expenses for a large order of his vegetables and he is also planning to reserve some seeds for next year's planting period

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for his business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad,  se dedica a varias actividades con el fin de proveer un mayor bienestar a su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en   de 5 y 8 años; Ella inició su negocio en la esquina de su casa, teniendo en cuenta lo estratégico de su punto comercial y allí resultó ser un éxito.  En su negocio vende ropa exterior para damas, ropa interior, vende también dulcería y ofrece servicios de llamadas a celulares; su negocio  muy pequeño y poco a poco ha ido creciendo por su trabajo esmerado y disciplina, para atesorar gradualmente peso a peso y responder a parte de los gastos de su familia. Su negocio de dulcería lo ofrece directamente pero ha conseguido vincularse a una empresa mediante medainte la cual venderá a través de guías especializadas de productos. Su principal clientela está ubicada al sur occidente de la ciudad, donde habita con su familia y su meta es aumentar su capital de trabajo,  para lograr mayores ingresos que junto a los de su esposo,  logren que sus hijos tengan un futuro exitoso, ofreciéndole una educación de mucha calidad. En la actualidad se acercan las navidades y el año nuevo, época de aguinaldos y su revista llegó con precios especiales, para que entre familias y amigos, puedan hacer obsequios muy económicos a todos sus seres queridos.  A su clientela Ana la ha hecho una visita de preventa y  le han encargado un  buen número de productos dulces, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr responder a la demanda, por eso está aplicando aun credikiva, con el cual comprará    dulces en hermosos empaques, que sus clientes compartirán con sus familiares, amigos y personas mas cercanas, así mismo comprará ropa para que las familias luzcan elegantes en estas lindas fiestas. Con esta inversión logrará aumentar su capital de trabajo aprovechando la temporada donde aumenta el consumo  de muchos artículos y hay mucho dinero circulante.
texts.en: Thirty-four-year-old Ana does various jobs so that she and her family - her husband and two children, who are five and eight years old - can prosper.  She started her business in her house, knowing that it was a strategic location and it was a success.  The business sells women's clothing and candy, as well as offering phone calls to cell phones.  Her business started small and, little by little, Ana's painstaking work and discipline has made the business grow, allowing her to cover some household costs.  She sells candy directly to customers but she now has links to a business through which she will sell with product specialists.  Her biggest group of customers are in the south west of the city where Ana lives with her family.  Her goals are to increase her working capital so that she has a bigger income, which she saves with her husband's, and to make sure that her children have a good education and are successful.  With Christmas and New Year approaching, so is the season of Christmas bonuses and there are special offers available so that families and friends can buy very inexpensive gifts for all their loved ones.  Ana has visited her customers who have ordered a good number of candies but Ana does not have enough working capital to cover demand.  She is applying for a loan to buy candy in pretty packaging, which her customers will share with close family and friends.  She will also buy clothes so that the families look elegant at parties.  With this investment, Ana will increase her working capital by taking advantage of the season when the consumption of many items increases and when there is a lot of money going about.

loans.use: to buy candy in pretty packaging and clothes for families to look elegant.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Oñondivepa, que significa todas juntas, y es que son 15 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo que trabajan juntas para poder salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Liz, la presidenta es parte de este grupo, comenta ella que siempre tiene muy buena predisposición para poder ayudar a sus amigas y que siempre las anima a seguir trabajando. Ella por su parte también trabaja, se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida, en la que trabaja todos los días.
Esta solicitando de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, carne, panificados, leche, yerba, azúcar y demás.
Liz y su grupo están contentas por trabajar juntas y quieren seguir haciéndolo, es por eso que pondrán todo de ellas para seguir juntas.
texts.en:
This group’s name is Oñondivepa, which means "all of us, together", and is composed of fifteen women from the city of San Lorenzo, who work together in order to get ahead in life and help each other.

Liz, the group’s president, says that she is always willing to help her friends and always motivates them to continue working. She is a saleswoman; she has a well assorted grocery shop in which she works every day.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her shop, such as beverages, meat, bakery products, milk, yerba mate and sugar.

Liz and her group are happy working together and want to continue doing it. This is why they will do whatever it takes to be together.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her shop, like beverages, meat, bakery products, milk, yerba mate and sugar.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming where he also grows potatoes, maize, vegetables in small scale; this has run for eight years. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenges he faces are finding customers and seasonal weather. 

Edward is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business and to plough the farm for potato growing too. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to establish large scale farming.

loans.use: to  buy tea tree seedlings for the business and to plough the farm for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy tea tree seedlings and some retail stock for the retail shop.

loans.name: Mohsafar

texts.ru: Мохсафар женщина с большим опытом в сфере шитья женской одежды. Ей 54 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет  2 детей. Ее муж пенсионер и получает не большую пенсию, которая не хватает для содержания семьи. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 39  лет назад она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она принимает заказы в ее собственном доме. Многие ее клиенты, ее соседи и женщины, живущие не далеко от ее района. Она старается обслуживать их на высшем уровне и таким образом привлечь много клиентов. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Доход от бизнеса она использует для содержания семьи. В этом году она планировала отремонтировать свой дом, однако она не смогла сделать сбережения для ремонта. Ее дом в аварийном состоянии и она должна срочно отремонтировать свой дом. С целью сделать ремонт она обращается за займом 1000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент и краски. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mohsafar is a woman who is very experienced in sewing women's clothing.  She is 54 years old and is married with two children at home.  Her husband is retired and receives a small pension which is not enough to support the family.  With the goal of providing for her family's needs, Mohsafar started a business 39 years ago sewing women's clothes.  She receives orders in her own home.  Many of her clients are her neighbors and women who live near her region.  She tries to give the highest level of service so as to attract many clients.  Thanks to her good service, she has a wide range of clients.  She uses the income from her business to support her family.  This year she had planned to renovate her home, but she was not able to save enough money for the repairs.  Her home is in an unsafe state and she urgently needs to make repairs on it.  With this renovation as the goal, Mohsafar is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy building materials like cement and paint.  She is counting on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and paint for repairing her house.

loans.name: Freddy Gilbert

texts.es:
FREDDY GILBERT tiene 42 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en Ventanas provincia de Bolivar.

Pertenece a la  VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

 FREDDY GILBERT se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz suave y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, líquidos para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la semilla. Las compras lo hará en Ventanas.

El sueño es poder comprar un terreno para seguir y comprar un carro. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en:
Freddy Gilbert is 42 years old and lives with his common-law wife and their son in Ventanas, in Bolivar province. He belongs to the "El Recreo" communal bank, which is located in the San Vicente Las Lomas rural settlement in the canton of Ventanas. Members of this communal bank do agricultural work, raising livestock and growing crops.

Freddy Gilbert works in agriculture, farming corn and rice. He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, urea, insecticides, and liquid weed killer. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and seeds in Ventanas.

His dream is to be able to buy land to keep farming and to buy a car. In his free time, he likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Gladys Birmania

texts.es:
GLADYS BIRMANIA tiene 40 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

 GLADYS BIRMANIA se dedica  a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas, ranger y alimento para los animales. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura.

El sueño es poder  darle los estudios al hijo para que culmine la educación y comprar mas terreno para seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta dormir y cuando puede bailar musica rock.
texts.en:
Gladys Birmania is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and son in Ventanas canton in De Los Rios province. 

She is a member of the "El Recreo" communal bank, located in the rural settlement of San Vicente Las Lomas, which is part of Ventanas canton. The members of this communal bank farm and raise livestock.

Gladys Birmania grows corn and raises chickens and pigs. She is applying for the loan to buy urea, fertilizers, manure, insecticides, herbicide and animal feed. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for farming. 

Her dream is to be able to provide for her son's schooling so that he can finish his education, and to buy more land so that she can continue farming. In her free time she likes to sleep, and when she can, dance to rock music.

loans.use: To buy urea, fertilizers, manure, insecticides, herbicide and animal feed.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro de 36 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida y su hijo. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años.  Álvaro cultiva los principales granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y maíz. Cada año repite esta actividad ya que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora. Vale la pena mencionar que vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, pero esta situación no lo desanima si no que le da fuerzas para continuar luchando por una calidad de vida diferente. Trabaja muy duro para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos  diferente a la agricultura. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar es préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra del abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y semillas. Con mucha confianza en Dios y en su trabajo espera tener una cosecha abundante de la cual pueda vender una parte y dejar otra parte para el consumo. Espera cumplir su sueño de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Álvaro is 36 years old and lives in a home of his own, along with his wife and son.  He has been a farmer for many years and raises basic grains such as rice, beans, and corn.  Each year he repeats this activity and it’s the only way he knows to earn a living.  He is a hardworking, enterprising person and lives under very humble conditions with his family, but this situation does not diminish him, instead it strengthens him to continue working toward a different quality of life for his family.  He works hard to bring home the bacon, since he doesn’t have another source of income, other than farming.  It’s for this reason that he has decided to request a loan though INTEGRAL so that he can invest in compost, fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds.  With his faith in God and his hard work, he hopes to have an abundant harvest.  He will sell part of it and use the rest for personal consumption.  He hopes to achieve his dream of providing a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rahmatjon

texts.ru: Рахматджону 33 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети Гайбуллочон, Маликахон и Муасумахон. Им 12, 11 и 4 года. Они учатся в средней школе, а младший еще ходит в детский сад. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому Рахматджон является единственным кормильцем в семье. Он всегда старается обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Он начал свою деятельность в пекарни. Он работал перевозчиком хлеба. Данное время он работает мастером по установки Алькобонда. Его коллеги знают его как доброго и трудолюбивого человека и очень дорожат его дружбой, потому что Рахматджон очень верный друг. Полученный доход он использует для содержания семьи со всеми не обходимыми вещами для проживания. Его дети, так как учатся в средней школе, нуждаются в компьютере, а также самому Рахматджону нужен компьютер для его работы. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для покупки компьютера. Этот займ поможет ему повышать уровень технического знания его детей. Будущим у него много планов и он старается реализовать всех. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rahmatjon is 33 years old and is married with three children.  Their names are Gaibullochon, Malikahon and Muasumahon and they are 12, 11 and 4 years old.  The elder two children are in high school and the younger one is in kindergarten.  Rahmatjon's wife is a homemaker and this is why he is the only breadwinner in the family.  He always tries to provide for his family's needs.  Rahmatjon started his business in baked goods - he worked as a bread driver - and now he works as an installer of aluminum composites.  His colleagues know him as a kind and hard-working man and they value his friendship because Rahmatjon is a true friend.  He uses his salary to support his family and provide for their needs.  Since his children are in high school, they need a computer, just as Rahmatjon himself needs it for his work.  He is asking for a loan of 500 US dollars to buy a computer.  This loan will help him increase his children's level of technological knowledge.  He has many plans for his future and he is trying to make them all happen.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
Gina es una señora muy trabajadora, madre de 2 niños, su único ingreso familiar es el que ella obtiene de la venta de los productos agrícolas que cosecha, tiene varios años dedicada a esta actividad, su meta es abarcar una mayor área de siembra para aumentar la cosecha y por supuesto sus ingresos económicos.
Solicita un préstamo de trescientos mil colones (¢300.000)para comprar semilla de maíz y frijol e insumos agrícolas para dar mantenimiento a su siembra durante el período de desarrollo hasta la cosecha.
Gina agradece todos los beneficios que ha obtenido por medio de las empresas de crédito comunal.
texts.en:
Gina, the mother of two children, is a very hardworking woman.  Her only family income is what she earns from selling the farm products she harvests.  She has been doing this work for several years.  Her goal is to plant a greater area to increase the harvest and, of course, her income.

She's requesting a loan for 300,000 colones [CRC] to buy corn seed, beans, and agricultural inputs to maintain her crops from the growing period up to the harvest.

Gina's grateful for all the benefits she has received through the efforts of the communal bank.

loans.use: to plant corn and to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Annie Wangari

texts.en:
Annie is a farmer from Kenya's Kiambu County, and she joined VEP through her group called the Think Self Help Group. She has been saving money successfully, and through VEP training she became interested in constructing a biodigester, as it will save her additional money on energy expenditures. 

She has a family of seven, but she only resides with her husband and a grandchild. She owns cows and sells their milk within her community and to a dairy farm near her home. Her husband is a casual laborer at a nearby tea factory. If Annie receives this loan, it will drastically improve her lifestyle, and her energy savings will allow her to comfortably repay the loan.

loans.use: To pay for a biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s circumcision celebration.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is an entrepreneur who works with a small team of socially minded partners to improve lives for farmers throughout Kenya. Her work involves training farmers and building market linkages with suppliers of environmentally friendly products that are needed within local communities. Over the last several years, Joyce has worked with thousands of low-income farmers that grow tea, coffee, flowers, and vegetables. She started Boma Safi Limited to support the many farmers who lack access to sustainable energy and products that alleviate poverty. 

The Boma Safi product line now includes solar energy solutions, as well as clean cookstoves, water purifiers, and women's health products. These goods are sold directly on farms, as well as in rural open-air markets and two small shops that Joyce now operates. Boma Safi (meaning "clean home" in Swahili) has quickly built a reputation as a trusted voice in the East African Fair Trade community.

Joyce leads a small team that conducts workshops on farms across Kenya, demonstrating the positive aspects of solar when compared to traditional energy sources such as candles, kerosene, and disposable batteries. With years of experience selling a variety of solar products, Joyce began working with One Degree’s team in Kenya in 2012 after collecting feedback from farmers about BrightBox, a new solar energy kit that powers lights, phones, and radios. During workshops, farmers would exclaim "stima!" - meaning electricity - when seeing BrightBox lights in action, and Joyce knew she found a winning solution.

Since September 2012, Joyce has already sold hundreds of BrightBox systems to farmers. She already has requests for many more, which she would like to provide before the holidays. While happy with her initial success, Joyce has been selling to farmers on a regular cash basis, while many others cannot afford to pay upfront. These same lower-income farmers are sadly stuck spending $10-$15 per month - a considerable portion of their income - on lighting and phone charging.

To break this cycle and provide renewable energy to these farmers, Joyce would like to start offering flexible payment terms to those who need it most. She seeks support from Kiva lenders to make this happen.

Joyce will use funds for 150 BrightBoxes, which will be used to energize and empower farming households across the region. Farmers will be able to collect BrightBox systems immediately and pay for them over several months. Since they are currently spending money on polluting, unsafe, and inefficient energy, most will save enough to recoup costs in 4-5 months and never worry about fuel or fire again. With your help, Joyce will help farming families eliminate energy expenses, improve safety, and allow their children to read into the night.

loans.use: to pay for solar energy systems and offer financing plans to lower-income farmers.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, un hombre emprendedor y muy humilde, tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y vive con su familia actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad y factible a la hora de ser comercializado. Este  agricultor que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a logrado encaminar su proyecto hasta el día de hoy, y este como tal, gracias a su dedicación ha respondido favorablemente, se encuentra en uno de los mejores de la zona y la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo y dando alegría a toda su familia ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
William, 52, is an enterprising and very modest man.  He's married and currently lives with his family.

He requested a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and fumigant.  He wants to care for his coffee crops to keep them in good condition as they grow, so he gets a good-quality and viable crop when it comes time to sell.

With a lot of effort and sacrifice, this farmer has managed to focus on his plan up to the present and, thanks to his dedication, he has had a favorable response, one of the best in the area.  This man's only limitation is the lack of money to continue growing and making his entire family happy, because they depend on his job to be able to get ahead.  This is why he's applying for a loan.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He had not had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Elibeth

texts.es: Elibeth, una mujer emprendedora y muy humilde, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y vive con dos hijos y el esposo  actualmente, ella solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, ella desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, para obtener un producto de buena calidad y factible a la hora de ser comercializado. Esta  agricultora que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a logrado encaminar su proyecto hasta el día de hoy, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Elibeth, 27 years old, is a very modest and enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and two children. 

She requests this loan with the desire to buy supplies such as fertilizers and fumigants for her coffee crops. In this way, Elibeth hopes to produce a better quality and more viable crop to sell. She has worked very hard and made many sacrifices to be able to get her business up and running today. She is requesting this loan to help her business, on which she relies heavily in order to get ahead.

This is Elibeth's first loan with FUDECOSUR. Although she has not built any credit with other banks, FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with good interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and fumigants.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin  tiene  43  años de edad, esta casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, herbicidas y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Martin is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children.  He plans to use his loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, sprays and herbicides, and to employ laborers.  He plans to work on his plantations so that he doesn't suffer any damage and doesn't lose any crops.  This will ensure that his coffee plantation makes more profits so that he can enjoy a better quality of life.  

This is Martin's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any previous loans from state banks.  FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.
