She wishes to be able to make progress in life, maintain a stable economic existence, and help her husband pay for household expenses.

loans.use: buy corn and lime to make tortillas

loans.name: Ana Marleny

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad por quienes trabaja muy duro para sacarlos adelante. Ana trabaja en su propio negocio en el que se dedica a la elaboración de desayunos y almuerzos en donde le va muy bien ya que su negocio está ubicado en un mercado regional en el que hay gran afluencia de personas diariamente, y ella posee mucho clientes fijos como personas que llegan a hacer sus comprar al mercado como personas que trabajan ahí. Ana solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para elaborar los alimentos como: carnes, granos básicos, verduras y así mismo bebidas para acompañar las comidas. Con esto Ana podrá aumentar la variedad de almuerzos y así mismo la cantidad, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ganancias notablemente.
texts.en:
Ana, 32 years old, is a single mother of two young children. She works very hard to help them get ahead. She makes a living preparing breakfasts and lunches. Ana has been very successful in this business, which is located inside a local market where there are many people each day. She has many regular customers who shop at the market, as well as those who work there.

Ana is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL so that she will be able to buy more of the ingredients she uses most often such as meat, basic grains, vegetables, as well as the beverages that accompany her meals. With this, Ana will be able to increase the variety of lunches she offers as well as the quantity she sells. This will help her to notably increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señorita Carmen es una joven de 19 años muy emprendedora, humilde y trabajadora, Carmen se define como una persona, honrada, con valores éticos inculcados por su madre para Carmen el trabajo le engrandece y le hace crecer día a día como una mejor persona, lo importante para ella es sacar adelante a su madre y a sus hermanos pequeños  y seguir estudiando para ser una profesional.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo invertirá en la compra de cuyes para la crianza y la venta, además también se invertirá en la compra de semilla de cebolla larga ya que poseen un terreno donde sembrar y con esto obtener mayores ingresos económicos para la familia.

El sueño que Carmen tiene es seguir con la crianza de animalitos y la agricultura y con los ingresos de estas actividades  ayudar en la casa de sus padres y a sus hermanos pequeños brindándoles el estudio, y más que todo mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen, 19 years old, is an enterprising, modest, and hardworking young woman. She describes herself as an honest person with ethical values that she learned from her mother. She feels that her work helps her grow each day into a better person. For Carmen, the most important thing is to help her mother get ahead and help her younger siblings to continue studying to one day become professionals.

The loan Carmen is requesting from Fodemi will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs to raise and sell. She will also buy seeds of large onions since she has a plot of land where she can sow them to later sell and increase her family's earnings. Carmen's dream is to continue to raise small animals and grow vegetables. Then, with her earnings, she can help out more at home and help pay for her siblings' education. Above all else, she hopes to raise her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and seeds to grow large onions.

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es: Carlos está pensando en que,  para  la navidad y el año nuevo que se acercan,  debe tener mucho inventario de los productos que produce y vende y por eso su capital de trabajo se convierte en su mayor desafío, pues elabora ropa de cama y comercializa, calzado, accesorios femeninos y de todo lo que su clientela justamente compra en Diciembre,  para celebrar en familia la navidad y el año nuevo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, calzado, ropa, tela, para elaborar sabanas, pues también conoce este arte y en Diciembre sus ventas de artículos de cama se incrementan. Desde hace 4 años cuando inició su negocio, su clientela ha ido creciendo, porque su experiencia le indica que clase de artículos vender en cada temporada y esto lo aprendió también de su madre y de su hermana que le ayudaron a iniciar este negocio. Las ventas de Carlos, las realiza una parte a crédito y otra de contado en periodos semanales; él trabaja diariamente desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde o más, si así lo requiere su clientela. Entre sus principales clientes, están sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y referidos por estos, que gradualmente, han ido incrementando sus cuentas por cobrar. Con su primer crédito con esta organización, logró aumentar sus ventas y   el volumen de sus compras, ahora sus metas,  giran alrededor de tener un local propio bien posicionado , en un espacio comercial de mucha concurrencia de clientes, para cada vez mas, aumentar sus ingresos vendiendo en mayores volúmenes.
texts.en:
With Christmas and New Year's Eve coming up, Carlos plans to increase his shop's inventory in order to be ready for the upcoming busy season. His customers are largely comprised of neighbors, friends, relatives and others to whom he has been recommended. Some of these, he allows to make purchases on credit, and others by weekly payments. For this reason, a lack of working capital has been Carlos' biggest challenge in carrying out his plan to better stock his store.

Since he opened his business four years ago, his clientele has been growing steadily. He has learned through experience and through the wisdom of his mother and sister, who helped him get started in this business, which items sell more during each season. Carlos works daily from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. or later if his customers require it. He makes and sells pajamas, footwear, women's accessories, and many other things customers are looking to buy in December to celebrate Christmas and the New Year with their families. That is why he is requesting this Kiva loan. It will be his second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Carlos will use this loan to buy footwear, clothing, and fabric to make sheets. His work is well-known, and in December, his bedding sales increase. With his first loan, Carlos was able to increase his sales. Now, his goals revolve around having a well-positioned business where he will attract more customers and, thus, increase his sales and revenue.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make sheets, shoes, and all kinds of clothing.

loans.name: Pelayo

texts.es:
Pelayo de 44 años comparte una vida conyugal con Urbana de 38 años, una pareja que tiene por misión brindarles a sus 3 hijos lo mejor de si y un buen futuro.
Lograron adquirir una vivienda de material noble con el fruto de muchos años de trabajo. Impulsados por sacar adelante a su familia decidieron dejar de lado las actividades agrícolas y dedicarle mas tiempo a sus pequeños, es así que desde hace 24 años laboran en el mercado de su localidad con su negocio consistente en la venta de productos de primera necesidad.
Optaron por esta actividad puesto lograron alcanzar una vacante siendo el puesto que ocupan hoy gracias a  la ampliación comercial que sufrió el mercado de su localidad en aquel entonces.
Muestra una gran interés por su trabajo ya que el realiza las actividades forzosas mientras que Urbana con el carisma y alegría que la caracteriza logra captar clientela haciendo de este un negocio familiar muy concurrido.
Se encuentran en una temporada cuyos comercios del rubro presentan un incremento en sus ventas para el cual desean reabastecer su negocio con productos de primera necesidad, adicional a ello las fiestas de  fin de año dan lugar a la venta de panetones cuya ganancia es beneficiosa para su negocio. 
Desean dentro de poco postular a la contrata de abastecimiento con víveres para una entidad del estado denominado “Comedores populares”, el cual sería una gran oportunidad de negocio que deseaban desde hace mucho e iniciar un nuevo rumbo para con su actividad comercial. Requieren contar con 4,000 nuevos soles e invertirlos en productos para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, enlatados, panetones y verduras logrando obtener ganancias extras por su compra al por mayor para esta temporada del año.
texts.en:
Pelayo, 44, lives with Urbana, 38, a couple who has the task of providing the best for their three children as well as a good future. 
They managed to buy a good quality home from the fruit of many years of work. Driven to get ahead they decided to put aside agriculture and spend more time with their children. So that is why, for 24 years, they’ve been working in their local market, their business consisting of the sale of basic necessities.

They chose this activity because they got a vacancy, being the place they occupy today, thanks to the expanding business that the market underwent back then. He shows a great interest in his work as he performs the heavy work while Urbana, with her charisma and joy, manages to capture customers making this a busy family business.

They are in a season which the business presents an increase in sales to which they want to replenish their business with basic necessities. In addition, yearend festivities give place to the sale of Christmas cakes whose gain is beneficial for their business.

Soon, they want to apply for a contract to supply provisions for a state agency called "soup kitchens", which would be a great business opportunity that they’ve wanted for a long time and start a new course for their business. 

They are requesting 4,000 Peruvian Soles to invest it in products for their business such as rice, sugar, canned goods, Christmas cakes and vegetables to obtain extra profit on his purchase at wholesale for this time of year.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, Christmas cakes and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es: José Gilberto, casado con hijos menores bajo su responsabilidad. Es el originario de Chichigalpa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Este hombre se caracteriza por ser una personas, trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. José Gilberto tiene por actividad económica la venta de granos básicos desde hace 8 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. José ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergente, jabón de  baño, pasta dental, maíz, trigo. José Gilberto agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es  Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: José Gilberto is married with minor children under his responsibility. He is originally from Chichigalpa, a place that is located in the northern zone of the country. This man is characterized as being a hardworking and responsible person with desire for personal improvement. José Gilberto has a financial business selling staple grains and has been in this said business for 8 years. José has already worked with Fundación and has demonstrated his responsibility in paying on time and in the right manner. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and supply his business with the purchase of staple grains such as: rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, bath soap, toothpaste, corn, wheat. José Gilberto is grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply his business with the purchase of staple grains such as: rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, bath soap, toothpaste, corn, wheat.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Con 49 años de edad Eusebio es un gran impulsador de su localidad, comparte una vida conyugal con Zulma de 38 años y complementa su alegría familiar con los 4 hijos que dios le ha regalado. Hace poco logro concretar la compra de un terreno y posteriormente culmino la construcción de una vivienda a base de adobe.
Docente de profesión pero micro-empresario por vocación tiene el orgullo de servir a su pueblo educando a los más pequeños en la escuela primaria donde labora. No obstante desde hace 1 años con apoyo de un socio al que considera un hermano de sangre logró implementar un taller de carpintería en donde con ayuda de un maestro carpintero realiza trabajos de ebanistería y otros adicionales del rubro. Comenta de optó por este negocio puesto que la zona en donde reside es rica en árboles madereros y resulta beneficioso en cuanto al precio de la materia prima que requiere para llevar adelante el negocio. Desde la fabricación de mesas, sillas y otros el ha notado que el negocio presenta un crecimiento considerable el cual lo motiva a seguir con un mayor entusiasmo cada día.
Por inicio de año próximo desea realizar la contrata a empresarios madereros con anticipación y adquirir materia prima para su negocio esperando así incrementar sus ganancias en lo posterior.
A futuro con el resultado del constante trabajo empleado desea ingresar al rubro de la fabricación de ataúdes y demás muebles mayores. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, agradece desde ya la gran oportunidad que le brindan puesto que siente que es una gran herramienta para el progreso de mucha gente. Como docente y guía aporta siempre con ideas de trabajo a su grupo siendo de mucha importancia.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado para la compra de bloques de madera y posterior elaboración de muebles.
texts.en:
At 49 years old, Eusebio is a big promoter of his city. He shares his married life with his wife Zulma who is 38 years old and complements his family joy with 4 children that God has given him. Recently he purchased some land and subsequently completed the construction of an adobe house. A teacher by profession, but by vocation a micro-entrepreneur, he is proud to serve the people of his town by educating the youngest ones in the elementary school where he works. 

However, for the last year, with the support of a partner whom he considers a blood brother, he managed to implement a woodworking shop where with the help of a master carpenter, he has made cabinet work and other items. He said that he opted for this business in a zone where he lives as it is rich in timber trees and is beneficial in terms of the price of raw materials needed to run the business. From the production of tables, chairs, and other items, he has noticed that the business has grown considerably which motivates him to continue with more enthusiasm every day. By the beginning of next year, he wants to hire wood workers ahead of time and buy raw material for his business thus increasing his earning later on.

In the future, as a result of the constant work, he wants to enter the the manufacturing of coffins and other large furniture. This is his first loan with MFP and he appreciates the great opportunity they provide because he feels that it is a great advancement for many people. As a teacher and guide, he thinks that always providing ideas to the group is very important. WIth the 2,000 soles, he will complement his capital destined to buy the wood blocks and later the completion of furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood blocks.

loans.name: Merari Elizabeth

texts.es: Merari de 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y una pequeña hija de 5 años de edad. Merari es una madre de familia muy responsable quien inicio su propio negocio con la ilusión de darle a su hija una vida mejor. Merari se dedica a la elaboración de bolsas, manteles e individuales para mesas, elaborado de plásticos con distintos estampados y colores, los cuales posteriormente comercializa de forma ambulante en distintas colonias y mercados. Con el sueño de hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar su producción y de este modo sus ventas, ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el que posea las posibilidades para invertir en la compra de diferentes plásticos con diversidad de diseños y así  mismo para comprar hilo especial para elaborar las bolsas y manteles.
texts.en:
Merari, 32, lives with her husband and a young daughter, age 5.  Merari's a very responsible mother who started her own business with the idea of giving her daughter a better life.  Merari earns a living making bags, tablecloths, and placemats made of plastic with different prints and colors.  She then sells them as a street vendor in various developments and markets.

With the dream of making her business grow and expanding her production and her sales, she's requesting a loan from Integral to invest in buying a variety of plastic material with various designs as well as special thread to make the bags and tablecloths.

loans.use: to buy plastic to make tablecloths

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is single, 48 years old and lives in Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City, Philippines.

Amy is a meat dealer to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock of meat.
Amy has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Amy hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of meat

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
This is Estella, She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She also has a food stall for additional income. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Estella hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She was also able to buy a vehicle with the loan.

She would like to apply for a 60,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Anita hopes to have more businesses. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Yuky Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Yuky  son de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, son 12 mujeres, quienes se unieron con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras y salir adelante por medio del trabajo.
Olga es un ejemplo a seguir, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde temprana edad trabajo para ayudar a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser de vestir, sport y demás. y es por medio de este trabajo que tiene como ayudar en los gastos de la casa y salir adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas, ya que se acercan las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo y quiere tener más prendas que poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. El comité está agradecido por la ayuda que están recibiendo, pues podrán invertirlo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The women from the Yuky committee are from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. There are 12 women who got together with the objective of helping each other get ahead through work.

Olga is an example to follow. She is a very hardworking woman who from an early age worked to help her family. She sells all types of clothing, such as formalwear, sportswear and more. Through this work she has a way to help with the household expenses and get ahead. She is asking for this loan to buy clothes, since Christmas is coming and she wants to have clothing to offer her customers. The committee is grateful for the help it is receiving, because they can invest it in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 2 female pigs to breed and increase the numbers of pigs he has.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres San Isidro es de la ciudad de Paraguarí. Las mujeres de este grupo al enterarse del programa de la Fundación Paraguaya les resulto una excelente  oportunidad para poder trabajar juntas y ayudarse, actualmente son 14 mujeres.
Juana es una de estas mujeres, se encarga de la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene productos muy buenos y frescos, los cuales ofrece a buen precio. Ella es una mujer muy simpática, lo cual la ayuda mucho en su trabajo, ya que tiene que tratar con muchas personas.
Juana quiere invertir en su negocio y es por eso que solicita de este crédito, para poder comprar frutas y verduras de estación y así seguir teniendo bien surtido su puesto y seguir obteniendo así los medios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The San Isidro women's committee is from the city of Paraguarí. The women of this group found out about the Fundación Paraguaya program and it turned out to be an excellent opportunity to be able to work together and help each other. Right now there are 14 women. 

Juana is one of these women. She sells fruits and vegetables. She has good customers because her products are very good and fresh and she offers them at a good price. She is a very likable woman, which helps her a lot at her work, because she has to deal with a lot of people.

Juana wants to invest in her business and that is why she is asking for this loan, so she can buy vegetables in season and thus maintain a good selection at her stand. This way she will have the means to help her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
San Roque es de la ciudad de Concepción, este grupo empezó tímidamente y gracias a su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Sus miembros son personas muy trabajadoras que quieren ayudar a sus familias y  a sus hijos, y es por ellos que trabajan.
Leongina es modista, se hizo de buena clientela gracias a sus buenos trabajos y al buen precio que tiene. Empezó con muy poco y hoy en día ya es muy conocida. Su sueño es podre tener un gran taller de costura, donde pueda tener varias maquinas y también poder ayudar a otras personas dando fuente de trabajo.
Leongina solicita de este crédito para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, cierres y otros insumos para poder seguir haciendo las prendas que hace y satisfacer asi los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
San Roque is from the city of Concepción. This group started timidly and thanks to its efforts is coming out ahead. Its members are very hard-working people who want to help their families and their children, and it's for them that they work.

Leongina is a dressmaker, she made herself a good clientele thanks to her good work and the good prices that she has. She started with very little and nowadays is already very well known. Her dream is to be able to have a large dressmaking workshop, where she is able to have various machines and also be able to help other people giving sources of work.

Leongina is requesting this loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, elastics, fasteners and other supplies to be able to continue making the garments that she makes and to satisfy the orders of her customers like this.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastics, fasteners and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Tacumbu Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Emprendedoras de Tacumbu"tiene mas de 2 años de trabajo. Ellas ponen todo de sí para poder seguir creciendo. Son mujeres con gran espíritu de superación y lucha.
La Sra. Ubaldina es una  integrante de éste comité, se unió al grupo para poder ayudar a su familia y por medio de su sacrificio sacarlos adelante. Ella es la presidenta del grupo, y se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa y también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Es una buena comerciante y está creciendo gracias a su trabajo y a la ayuda que está recibiendo de parte de su grupo.
Ubaldina solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos y también de insumos para su despensa, ya que quiere llenar su stock para ofrecer mejor variedad a sus clientes.
El grupo agradece por la ayuda que recibe, pues les será de gran ayuda para poder seguir creciendo en lo que cada una hace.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras de Tacumbu" communal bank has more than two years of work experience.  They give it their all in order to be able to continue growing.  They are women with great spirit to improve and work hard.

Ubaldina is a member of this bank.  She joined the group to be able to help her family and get them ahead in life through this offering of hers.  She is the president of the group and makes a living through sales since she has a dispensary and also through the sale of cosmetics.  She is a good merchant and is growing thanks to her job and the help that she is receiving on behalf of her group.

Ubaldina asks for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of cosmetics and also supplies for her dispensary because she wants to fill up her stock in order to offer a better variety to her customers.

The group is grateful for the support they receive since it will be a great help to keep growing in what they each do.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and supplies for the dispensary.

loans.name: José Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor José Marcelo tiene ya mas de 10 años con sus negocios una es la elaboración de tacos y lonches este negocio lo atiende en las noche y tiene otro de cerrajero que es elaboración de las llaves este lo atiende en el día.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material para su negocio de tacos y lonches ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de productos y que sus clientes le están solicitando que elabore como es burritos y hamburguesas, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para llevar a cabo esta productos.
El señor José Marcelo es padre de familia soltera tiene bajo su responsabilidad a tres hijos los cuales están estudiando sus dos hijas están estudiando la preparatoria y su hijo la secundaria. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de tacos y lonches es para pagar el crédito y que con el ingreso que tiene del la cerrajería es para los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos.
El señor José Marcelo ya ha tenido créditos con KIVA el cual pago puntualmente y fue para invertir en su negocio el cual pudo comprar el equipo que necesitaba para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende. Así como su negocio ha crecido también su ingreso los cuales ha podido sacar a delante a sus hijos.
texts.en: José Marcelo already has more than ten years working with his business of making tacos and lunches at night and with his other business as a locksmith making keys during the day. He is requesting a loan to purchase materials for his taco and lunch stands as they are missing a variety of products. His customers are asking him to make things like burritos and hamburgers, but he does not have the necessary capital to carry that out. José Marcelo is a single parent and is responsible for three children who are all studying. His two daughters are studying in preparatory school and his son is in high school. The earnings from his tacos and lunches, are to pay the loan and the income that he has from being a locksmith is used for family and school expenses for his children. José Marcelo has already had loans from KIVA which he paid on time and were to invest in his business, which allowed him the equipment necessary to prepare the food he sells. As his business has grown, his revenue has also helped him support his children.

loans.use: to buy materials for his taco bar and lunch counter.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El Sr. Enrique es una persona muy trabajadora, ya ha solicitado un crédito de Kiva anteriormente, y el cual lo ha invertido en la compra de insumos para su local, para poder tenerlo bien surtido. Comenta que el crédito le ha sido de mucha ayuda y es por eso que solicita de nuevo otro.
Quiere este crédito para poder seguir surtiendo su negocio con mas productos, ya que se acerca la época donde mas ventas tiene y quiere comprar bebidas, comestibles, enlatados y demás.
Agradece de nuevo por la oportunidad que una vez mas esta recibiendo, ya que de esta forma podrá crecer y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Enrique is a very hardworking person. He has already applied for a Kiva loan in the past, which he invested in the purchase of supplies for his store in order to have it well stocked. He comments that the loan has been a great help to him, and it is for this reason that he is applying for a new loan.

He wants this loan in order to be able to continue stocking his store with more products, since the season in which he has more sales is getting close, and he wants to by beverages, foodstuffs, canned goods and other items.

He again appreciates the opportunity that he is once more receiving, since in this way he will be able to grow and continue helping his family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, foodstuffs, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
This is Gil. He previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities of office and school supplies. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 55,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Gil hopes to be a successful businessman. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Fedeliza

texts.en:
This is Fedeliza, who previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan, which she used buy fruit to sell at her fruit stand. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new loan, in the amount of 12,000 PHP, to purchase more fruits to sell in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She is also a tricycle operator, and that generates income for her family as well.

Fedeliza dreams that her children will finish their studies and hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional inventory of fruits to sell at her fruit stand.

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Buena Esperanza está conformado por 9 integrantes, ocho mujeres y un hombre .Personas , trabajadoras, responsables, con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son personas  humildes luchadoras. Estos integrantes  son  originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de norte del país. El sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, cuajadas, crema. Lorenza  es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de responsabilidad de  pago de las integrantes en tiempo y forma. Lorenza tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos. Ubicada en su casa de habitación. La rutina de esta mujeres salir a las comarca aledaña a buscar lote de cerdos para la crianza y venta del mismo. El banco comunal Buena Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Buena Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of nine members, eight women and one man, hardworking and responsible people with 20 children in their care.  They are modest people and fighters.  These members are from El Sauce, an area known for producing milk, curd, and cream in the northern part of the country.

Lorenza, the coordinator of the communal bank, is in charge of making timely payments for the group.  Lorenza's business is raising and selling pigs at her house.  The routine of these women is to go out to the neighboring communities to look for a batch of pigs to raise and sell.

Buena Esperanza Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have a decent living.

loans.use: to buy and sell a batch of pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, who previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of the tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new loan, in the amount of 25,000 PHP, to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of the tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education, and hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Toro Blanco Group

texts.es:
El comité Toro Blanco esta integrado por 14 señoras humildes de la ciudad de Caaguazú. Cada día se esmeran mas para ser mejores en las labores que hacen y así poder ayudar a sus hijos y familiares.
Angela es parte de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de perfumes de todas clases y marcas, para damas y caballeros. Es muy buena vendedora y gracias a su trabajo está saliendo adelante, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante y es por eso que día a día lucha.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder comprar más perfumes, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con ellos. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe, pues les ayuda muchísimo.
texts.en:
Toro Blanco (White Bull) Communal Bank is made up of 14 humble women from the city of Caaguazú. They put a bigger effort everyday to improve their work and thus help their children and relatives. 
Angela is a member of this group. She sells perfumes of all types and brands for men and women. She is a very good saleswoman and is progressing thanks to her hard work. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who wants to move forward in life and that is her reason for working everyday.
She is asking for a loan to buy more perfumes to fulfill the many orders she has from her customers. She is very grateful for this loan because it will support her to a great extent.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes to sell

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
Con la confianza de poder ayudar a sus hijos y su familia y que con  el acompañamiento de la Fundación podrían lograrlo, se formó un comité con 14  señoras humildes y por sobre todo muy trabajadoras de la ciudad de Caaguazú.
Una de estas mujeres del grupo es la Sra. Laura, quien por medio de la venta de bebidas en general puede salir adelante. Ella comenta que su grupo la ha ayudado mucho y que también las capacitaciones lo han hecho. El deseo de Laura es agrandar su negocio y el día de mañana tener un gran local de venta de bebidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, como ser sidras, cervezas, gaseosas, vinos, etc, ya que quiere tener un buen stock de bebidas, ya que se acerca la época en la que mas ventas tiene y quiere tener una buena ganancia.
texts.en:
Convinced that they would be able to help her children and families and confident in that it would be possible with the support of this institution, 14 humble and hardworking women from the city of Caaguazú created a Communal Bank.
One of these women is Laura, whose livelihood is selling beverages. She says her group and the training sessions have helped her very much. It is her desire to expand her business and to have a large liquor store in the future. 
She is asking for a loan in order to buy beverages such as wine coolers, beers, sodas, wines, etc, in order to have an extensive stock for her busiest season and she wants to make a good profit.

loans.use: to purchase wine coolers, beer, sodas, wines, etc.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria vive en la cálida ciudad de Aguaytia, ciudad ubicada en la selva peruana la cual se caracteriza por sus paisajes hermosos y sobre todo por la calidez y generosidad de sus pobladores.  Maria es madre soltera, ha sacado adelante sola a sus 4 hijos a quienes quiere muchísimo y son su razón de vivir y su motivo para luchar cada dia ya que ella se siente feliz solo cuando sus hijos lo están. Maria no tuvo estudios superiores debido a sus pocos recursos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser Profesora, es por ello que trabaja muy duro para darles la oportunidad a sus hijos en ser mucho mejores que ella.

Día a Día Maria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida típica, especialmente juane, tacaco con cecina, entre otros, ella prepara sus platillos de manera deliciosa y cada día puede llegar a atender hasta 25 personas; es por ello que cree que le va bien en su negocio, por su sazón y su amable atención.

Maria está muy agradecida con la oportunidad que le están brindando los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al crédito podrá comprar mesas, sillas, así como también poder comprar insumos al por mayor como arroz, azúcar en saco, fideos por paquetes; de esta manera podrá tener todo los materiales e insumos necesarios y así poder seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the warm city of Aguaytia, a city in the Peruvian jungle which is know for its beautiful landscapes and above all, the warmth and generosity of its people. Maria is a single mother, she has supported her 4 children who she loves very much, and are her reason to live and her motive to fight everyday as she is only happy when her children are. Maria had no higher education because of her low income, but she would have liked to have studied to be a professor, which is why she works so hard to give the opportunity to her children so they can do better than her. 

Day by day, Maria works in her small business selling traditional food, especially juane, tacaco with jerky among others. She prepares her dishes so deliciously that she can serve up to 25 people everyday, which is why she believes she is doing well in her business; her good seasoning and her kind attention. 

Maria is very grateful for the opportunity the Kiva borrowers are giving her. Thanks to the loan she will be able to buy tables, chairs, as well as supplies in bulk such as rice, sugar, and packets of noodles. This way she will have all materials and supplies needed so she can keep fighting every day to achieve her biggest dream: "To give a good education to her children and a better quality of life."

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina. She previously accessed a loan of 22,000 Philippine pesos (Php) that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help toward her children’s education and their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another Php 30,000 loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better, because more items to sell will result in a better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Angelina hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
This is Amalia, 40, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Richard, a seaman, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amalia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices, and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Amalia hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат молодой, энергичный и добросовестный человек. Ему 20 лет. Он холост и живет с родителями. После окончания школы у него не было возможностей, чтобы продолжить учебу в университете. Он начал работать 4 года назад на местном кафе, в должности шашлычника. Он изготавливает   шашлыки из баранины, говядины и куриного мяса. Он мастер своего дела и его клиенты в восторге от его шашлыков. Шавкат имеет хорошую репутацию среди работников кафе. Родители Шавката простые рабочие и они не в состоянии отремонтировать их дом. Шавкат решил сам отремонтировать дом, однако у него нет достаточно денег для этого. Он хочет отремонтировать дом и потом женится, то есть он хочет создать хорошую жилищную условию для будущей жены. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, краски и т.п. для ремонта дома. Он кредитуется первый цикл и обещает погасить займ во время. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shavkat is an energetic and conscientious young man. He is 20 years old. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. After graduating from school, he did not have the opportunity to continue his education at university. He began to work four years ago in a local cafe as a shashlik (shish-kebab) griller. He makes shashliki (shish-kebabs) from lamb, beef and chicken. He is an expert at grilling and his customers are crazy about his shashliki. Shavkat has a good reputation among the workers at the cafe. 

Shavkat's parents are simple laborers and do not have the means to repair their house. Shavkat decided to repair the house himself. However, he does not have enough money for this. He wants to repair the house and then get married, which is to say, he wants to create a good housing situation for a future wife. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3500 somonis to purchase building materials such as cement, paint, etc. for home repair. This is his first loan and he promises to repay it on time. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and paint for repairing his house

loans.name: Sutiava Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal Sutiava está conformado por 14 integrantes, todas madres solteras, con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del municipio del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de norte del  país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadoras, de buenas costumbres. En los créditos anteriores han demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. Martha es la coordinadora del banco comunal Sutiava la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad del banco Sutiava en cuanto a los pagos en tiempo y forma. Martha tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general la cual consisten en vender ropa como pantalones, camisas, faldas, short, ropa de dormir, ropa interior, perfumes, cosméticos. Actividad que inicio por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo digno para poder manter a sus hijos y brindarles mejores condiciones. El objetivo del prestamos en invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio y aprovechar la temporada navideña donde las ventas se incrementa y se obtiene mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Sutiava agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The communal bank, Sutiava, consists of 14 members, all single mothers with a total of 20 children under their responsibility. The originate from the town of Sauce which is located in the north of the country. These women are characterized as responsible, hardworking and well mannered. In previous loans, they have demonstrated their responsibility of paying in a timely manner. Martha is the coordinator of the communal bank Sutiava and is in charge of the banks responsibility for paying in a timely manner. Martha works selling general merchandise which consists of pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, sleepwear, underwear, perfumes and cosmetics. She started this work because of the need to have a decent work to be able to support her children and provide better conditions. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business to take advantage of the Christmas season when the sales increase and she earns a better income. The communal bank Sutiava appreciates the assistance the Kika investors provide to people with limited resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock their store with general merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, sleepwear, underwear, perfume, cosmetics.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
15 son las mujeres emprendedoras que quisieron unirse para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo en conjunto. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de barrio que quieren salir adelante y tienen como objetivo crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Lorena, quien es parte de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, y no desaprovecha cualquier ocasión para poder ir creciendo. Ve una gran oportunidad para ella y su familia al formar parte de este grupo.
Solicita del crédito para la compra de prendas, para tener una mejor variedad y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Las miembros están contentas porque han podido ir mejorando mucho en lo que cada una hace.
texts.en:
This is a group of 15 entrepreneurial women who came together to help their families through their joined effort. They are all friends and neighbors wanting to progress in life and having growth as a goal, not only in financial terms but also as individuals.
Lorena is a member of this group. She makes a living by selling clothes. She works everyday since very early in the morning and she doesn't let pass any opportunity to grow. She sees her participation in this group as a great opportunity for her and her family. 
Lorena is asking for this loan to buy garments to expand her offer. All group members are happy because each one of them has been able to improve in their activity.

loans.use: Comprar prendas para la venta.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites, 50, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marites operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers produce every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of raw materials, like fabrics and thread, for her rug-making business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marites hopes that her children will finish college and will have a good life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cloth, thread and other materials she needs for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita, 54, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eugenio and a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household, while she operates a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                  
           
Mercedita operates a van rental business. They have one van that they offer for rent, to be used for transportation service or by people who need the van for out-of-town transportation. They provide their services within the city and nearby provinces. In addition to this, Mercedita sells processed meats for more income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her van rental business, she is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts, and pay for maintenance, for her van. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mercedita hopes that her business will grow and that her children will have a good future. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío es una mujer joven de 36 años de edad, divorciada y tiene dos hijos, los cuales viven con ella y estudian. Es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de superación. Ha tenido que luchar para salir adelante con sus hijos. Su negocio es una sala de belleza y le va bien por el trato que le da a sus clientes, a pesar de que brinda sus servicios en la sala de su casa. Necesita invertir más en el mismo para ofrecer más técnicas a sus clientas. Además de recibir cursos técnicos para actualizarse en lo que corresponde a pintado de uñas. Con el préstamo va comprar equipo para hacer manicure y pedicure, también materia prima como tintes, pinturas de uñas y otros; y capacitarse.
texts.en: Rocío is a young, 36-year-old woman. She is divorced and has two children who live with her and attend school. She is a hard worker who wishes to improve the quality of her life. She has had to struggle in order to offer her children better conditions. Her business is a beauty salon and she does well because of her service, despite the fact that her business is located in the living room of her house. She needs to invest more in her business and to be able to offer more services to her costumers and to enroll in a technical refreshment course on nail decoration. With this loan she will buy equipment for manicure and pedicure as well as supplies such as hair dyes, nail polish and others besides her training.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, meat, and seasoning to make sandwiches

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
This is Florentina, 46, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a married to Anacleto and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Florentina operates a doormat making business. Her products are small rugs and larger doormats. She makes round rugs out of excess textile cloth she bought from the factory. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Florentina sells her products directly to her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like cloth, fabric and thread. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Florentina hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
This is Estelita. She previously accessed an 17,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Estelita hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддасу 40 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 сына. Ее муж работает мастером ремонта домов. Его сын окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Мукаддас более 4 года занимается услугой швеи. Она работает в ателье в центре города. Ее муж не зарабатывает достаточно денег и Мукаддас всегда сама справляется с расходами. Мукаддас живет в не отремонтированном доме. Ее дом имеет плохое состояние, и она должна отремонтировать свой дом, так как у нее нет сбережения, она обратилась в Имон Интернешнл за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как краски, цемент и т.п. для ремонта дома. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить условие проживания и таким образом стимулировать моральное состояние семьи. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mukaddas is 40 years old. She is married and has one son. Her husband works as a home repairman. Her son graduated from secondary school and enrolled in university. Mukaddas has worked as a seamstress for more than four years. She works in a tailor shop in the city center. Her husband does not earn enough money and Mukaddas always manages the expenses by herself. Mukaddas lives in a house that is in disrepair. Her house is in bad condition and she needs to repair it, but because she does not have any savings, she approached IMON International for a loan. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to purchase building materials such as paint, cement, etc. for home repair. This loan will help her improve her housing situation and, as a result, improve the morale of the family. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and paint for repairing her house

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth. She previously accessed an 17,000 PHP loan that she used buy greater quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lilibeth dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education and hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a whole cow for himself

loans.name: Ashur

texts.ru: Ашур живет в городе Исфаре. Ему 48 лет. Он женат, имеет 2 детей. Ашур уже 18 лет на базарах города Исфары занимается куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Для расширения своей деятельности он собирается купить еще несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Ashur lives in the city of Isfara. He is 48 years old. He is married and has two children. For the past 18 years, Ashur has been in the business of buying and selling cattle at the city's bazaars. For the expanision of his business, he plans on purchasing some more cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more VCD & DVD movies for resale.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
This is 46 year old Eddie.  He is married and has four children aged seven, fifteen, eighteen and twenty-one, all of whom are attending school. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to help with the household chores.  In 1995, Eddie established a business selling school bags, umbrellas and clothes. He began his business in order to be self-reliant. It is located in city center and his main customers are adults of both sexes. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,633,000 every month. 

Eddie has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to increase his stock of T-shirts, jeans, shoes, and socks. He hopes that this loan can help him improve his business and add to his profits. In the future, Eddie plans to construct a house on a piece of land nearby. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to increase his stock of clothes

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena, 29, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to John Rey, a vendor, and is a mother to their child. She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorena operates a market stall. She sells fruits and vegetables in the community market. She buys a quantity of fruits and vegetables and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lorena dreams to expand and grow her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more patented drugs.

loans.name: Sadiatu

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Sadiatu. She is married and has 3 children aged three, five and twelve, two of whom are attending school. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her to help with the household chores. In 2005, Sadiatu established a business selling textiles, mobile phones and accessories, which she started after dropping out of school in order to be self-reliant. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are women and men. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,613,000 every month. 

Sadiatu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy more African dresses and mobile phone accessories. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock and maximize her profits. In the future, Sadiatu plans to move from a wooden kiosk to a concrete shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more African dresses and mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 30 year old Ibrahim.  He is married and has 3 children aged two, six and eight, two of whom are attending school. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him to help with the household chores.  In 2007, Ibrahim established his business selling DVDs, VCDs and DVD players and accessories. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant after returning from the mines. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,663,200 every month. 

Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy DVDs and recorded films. He hopes that this loan will improve his stock and his sales. In the future, he plans to buy a piece of land and construct a house. He thinks the loan can increase his profits. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and recorded films

loans.name: Jaznalyn

texts.en:
This is Jaznalyn. She previously accessed an 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jaznalyn dreams to be able to expand soon and hopes to have a strong and healthy body. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jambuli

texts.en: Jambuli is 61 years old. He lives with his wife, son and mother in the Abasha district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 5 cows whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Jambuli is a very hard-working man and has a wealth of experience in his business. He has requested a loan to purchase feed for the cattle. This will fatten his cows properly and he will be able to expand his dairy farm and thus increase the sales of dairy products in the future. With the increased income the family will improve their living conditions. Jambuli awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his cattle

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo ya ha tenido créditos con KIVA los cuales han sido para el mejoramiento a su vivienda, gracias a estos créditos su patrimonio a crecido y su familia tiene mas espacio, esta en mejores condiciones y mas seguro.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un crédito y que a su vivienda le esta haciendo falta un techo de madera al frente de la casa, pero por el momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para compare el material y que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horaria adicional a su empleo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía, ya que con las ganancias que obtiene su esposa la señora Esmirna de su trabajo como costurera y de limpieza en diferentes casa particulares, es para los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos.
Desea que su vivienda esta protegida y su familia del clima ya que esta la temporada de lluvia el techo les protegerá de la humedad y enfermedades.
Espera contar nuevamente con su cooperación en este crédito ya que es para el beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo has already had loans with Kiva which have been for improving his house. Thanks to these loans his wealth has grown and his family has more space. They live in better, safer conditions. 

Guillermo is asking for a new loan because his house is missing a wooden roof at the front (seen in the photo), but for the moment he does not have the capital necessary to buy the material. He will take responsibility for the improvements by working extra hours at his job.

He plans to pay back the credit with wage he receives in his work as a security guard at a company, because the earnings his wife Esmirna obtains with her work as a seamstress and as a cleaner in various houses is for household expenses and his childrens' education. 

Guillermo wants his house and his family to be protected from the climate because right now it is the rainy season and the roof protects them from the humidity and diseases.

He hopes he can once again count on your cooperation for this loan because it is for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: to put a wooden roof on the front part of his house

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is divorced and has two children. She sells African print cloth and bags near Kwarhinkrom. She has done this for five years. 

Her loan will be used to buy more African print cloth and bags. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy African print cloth and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes and dye colors for a clothes dyeing business

loans.name: Seap

texts.en:
Seap (in the photo) and his wife, Touch, are rice farmers. In addition, he is also a fisherman and does house construction work. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, and they have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two are married, one is a chef for a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and the other one attends school. 

Seap is applying for a loan in the amount of $600 to continue his farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To continue his farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Takuru Group

texts.es:
El Comité Kuña Aty Takuru se formo en el Barrio Takuru de la Ciudad de Caaguazú actualmente estan en el primer ciclo es conformado por 20 señoras vecinas de la zona que trabajan diariamente para mantener a sus familias.
Maria Estela, es parte de este grupo, ella vende verduras, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas, pepinos, etc. Lo hace de forma ambulante, y así se gana la vida. Día a día lucha y con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Ahora con este programa de la fundación y con la ayuda de Kiva quiere invertir en su negocio para poder ir creciendo de a poquito y poder ayudar a su familiar. Sueña con poder ser una gran microempresaria.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras variadas, con lo cual podrá surtirse y seguir vendiendo y teniendo los ingresos para afrontar los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty Takuru Committee was started in the Takuru neighborhood of the city of Caaguazu. It is made up of 20 local neighborhood women who work daily to manage the family affairs. They are currently in their first loan cycle.

Maria Estela is a member of this group. She sells vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, cucumbers, etc. She sells her goods in the street, and she is able to make her living this way. Day by day she fights and with all her effort she is getting ahead. Now with this group program and with the assistance of Kiva she wants to invest in her business to continue growing little by little and to be able to support her family. She dreams of being a leading micro-entrepreneur. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase a variety of vegetables, which will allow her to restock and continue making sales, thereby bringing in income to meet the costs of her household.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim is 34 years old, and her husband, Rat, is 55 years old. They live in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children – three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are garment workers, one works for a hotel, one attends school, and another is still young. 

Khim used to be a garment worker, but she quit to take care of her young child. Her husband's salary and her children's salaries are the family's main sources of income.

Khim is applying for her first Kiva loan in the amount of $1,000 to fill in the land around her house and renovate her home.

loans.use: To fill in the land around her house and renovate her home.

loans.name: Seruling Group

texts.en:
Titin is the leader of the five person group named “Seruling”. They live in the "Jatinegara" village in the east of Jakarta. Titin is a young, 25-year-old mother with two cute children, Cindi, 6 years old, and Bembi, 2 years old.  Titin’s husband is unemployed and her mother-in-law lives together with her family now.

Titin has a kiosk in front of her house where she sells some kind of juice and instant drink. She started her business 3 years ago. In a day she can earn income of 100,000 IDR per day. From this business Titin can supply her family needs and buy her children some new clothes.

Titin and the other members of the "Seruling" group are requesting financial support from VisionFund Indonesia for the 2nd time so that they can increase their working capital. Titin will use it to buy fruits, such as guava, mango and strawberry, and bottled mineral water. Also, she plans to buy clothes on credit so she can look out for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits, such as guava, mango and strawberry, and bottled mineral water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional scrap for a scrap selling business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials such as fabric and thread needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their family's personal, household and business expenditures. She now owns a tricycle that adds to her income as well.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educate her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jocelyn dreams of giving her children a good, high-quality education and dreams of having a happy family. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials, such as fabric, cloth and thread, for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Gladys has been running a produce business to earn additional income and supplement her work as a small scale farmer for five years. She wishes to construct a permanent house as she is currently living under a mud wattled house. Gladys also wants to educate her children so that they can, at a minimum, attain degrees. She supplies schools on credit and faces hardships due to their delayed payments. Her goal is to own a food store that can sustainably supply her customers year-round. Gladys intends to use the loan to buy maize, beans, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
This is Eufrocina, a 39-year-old resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ramon, a businessman and a mother to her children.
