She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Eufrocina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. She also sells vegetables. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Eufrocina hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams that all her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred used the previous loan to weed, plough and buy insecticides for his garden. He is a 42-year-old, hardworking man who lives in Kasese, Uganda with his seven children. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for ten years after starting his farm with 300,000 shillings; he now has capital of 3,500,000 shillings. His major hardships are high fuel and transportation costs, price fluctuations and inflation while his business goal is diversifying his farm to include animal rearing. Alfred is requesting a loan to pay workers who are harvesting his maize garden.

loans.use: to pay workers who are harvesting his maize garden.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a 55-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been selling beer and soft drinks for 15 years. He started with five million shillings and now has over 30 million shillings as working capital. His hardships are taxes, customers not paying on time, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is expanding the business into new markets. Robert intends to use the loan to buy beer and soda to sell ahead of the Christmas season when demand is very high.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a thirty-six-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. For twelve years he has been a teacher and was inspired into the profession by his love to inspire the young generation. He also does farming in order to supplement his salary. He is a very hardworking man who has been able to build a permanent residential house in a year but is now challenged by inadequate capital to install utilities such as water and electricity. Stanley intends to use the money to pay electricians to install power in his house.

loans.use: to pay electricians to install power in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуде 51 года. Она разведена и на воспитание имеет 1 сына. Так как она мать одиночка и должна обеспечить своего сына сама, несколько лет назад она занималась купле продажей женской одежды. С некоторыми причинами она остановила свой бизнес. Теперь она хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она будет продавать свой товар на местном рынке своего района, а также около своего дома. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своего сына хорошим условием проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavluda is 51 years old. She is divorced and is raising one son. As a single mother she has to provide for her son for herself and has been selling women's clothing several years ago. She had to stop this business for some reason. At this time she wants to start her business reselling food. With this goal Mavluda has taken a course called Achieve Success organized by the Association of Business Women and has received a certificate. Now she can start her business and become successful in this field. She will sell her merchandise on the local market of her region as well as near her house. She plans to use the profit to provide her son with good living conditions. Mavluda is asking for a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni to buy merchandise to start her business. She is looking forward to your generosity.

loans.use: to buy food for start a new business.

loans.name: Aurore

texts.fr:
Madame Aurore est l’employée de World vision. Elle est mariée et âgée de 31 ans. Elle a 3 enfants dont le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 5 ans. Tous ses enfants vont à l’école. Madame Aurore a une autre personne en sa charge.
Elle est née au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de l’université.
Elle est au premier cycle de crédit.
Le crédit lui octroyé lui permettra  d’acheter le ciment, le sable et paiera la main d’œuvre pour construction de sa maison. La guerre et la maladie grave sont les seules difficultés  de non remboursement de ce prêt qu’attend Madame Aurore.
Comme stratégie, elle va travailler en corps et en âme pour être appréciée par son employeur, ceci lui permettra de bénéficier des promotions.
Pour sa famille, elle a l’ambition de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aurore is an employee of World Vision.  She is 31 years old and married.  She has three children between the ages of 10 and 5, who all attend school.  She also has another person in her care.

Aurore was born in Rwanda and she completed four years of university.  

This is her first loan cycle.  This loan will allow her to buy cement and sand, and to pay for the cost of labor associated with building her house.  Except for war or serious illness, she is expecting no repayment difficulty on this loan. 

Her (business) strategy is to devote herself to her work and be appreciated by her employer, in order to increase her chances of being promoted. 

As far as her family is concerned, her ambition is to continue to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand, and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice farm.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a hardworking forty-six-year-old man, with eleven children living in Fort Portal Uganda. His main business is a produce business, alongside selling smocked fish, as an additional income. He faces hardships of too much rain which affect his movements to transport his produce to markets.  His business plans are to set up a food store and buy a pickup to ease his movements. William is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Constence's Group

texts.en:
Constence's group is comprised of 7 hard working women. Constence is 23 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 2 years, Constence has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells cassava flour.
To help expand her business, Constence has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cassava flour for resell, and will help Constence to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills. Constence hopes that in the future she will be able to build a permanent house of her own.
Constence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods,snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a fifty-two-year-old married man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is crop production, and in addition a dairy cow that earns him additional income from milk sales. His main challenges are unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations.  He has plans of buying a solar system, educate his children, buy a car and complete construction of his residential house.  Micheal is requesting a loan to buy land and expand his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy land and expand his banana plantation.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 64 years old and married with three children.
Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell.
Basilisa has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling rice business for 12 years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugarcane.
Basilisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell.
